Title: Data Analyst - Early Collections
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst ‚Äì Early Collections







Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst ‚Äì Early Collections to join our Collections Expert Unit, Team of Easy Financing Tribe.




The responsibility of this team is to make the difference by being customers‚Äô partner in times of financial difficulties, while protecting bank interest and our way of working is Agile.




Your key responsibilities:




As an Data Analyst Early Collections, you will:




Positively contribute to the team responsible for delivering a high-quality early collections service.

Co-create and lead

the strategy and the roadmap to achieve the best-in-class collections services

the precise and safe execution of the operational processes and automated collections workflow configuration in the Collections Tool

the external collections agencies coordination and monitoring, iv) the evolution towards a more data driven and digital service.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




Expertise in managing collections services, amicable and legal collections services, for direct portfolios or third-party services, for more than 3 - 5 years.




Degree in Economics, Business, Math or Engineering (bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in).

Proficient knowledge of Excel and SQL. Other programming languages such as SAS/MicroStrategy/Power BI would be welcome.

High Level of English.




Expertise in the banking industry, expertise or technical knowledge in collections software management or experience in digital collections will be valued.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.

Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!

Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.

Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶

Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.

Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!

More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, financial, and social).

Health services in company (physiotherapy, phycological and medical services).

Orange sports (football, basket, running, golf, gympass ‚Ä¶).

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1600 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clints decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst - Contact Center - Ventas
Description:
üåç‚ÄúCuidar de las personas y empresas para hacer del mundo un lugar m√°s seguro, manteni√©ndonos a la vanguardia de la innovaci√≥n‚Äù es lo que nos motiva desde hace m√°s de 40 a√±os.

Dentro de Movistar Prosegur Alarmas, queremos incorporar un Data Analyst. Ser√° el responsable de recopilar, analizar y visualizar datos relacionados con las actividades de ventas del contact center y colaborar√° estrechamente con los equipos de ventas y marketing para garantizar la efectividad de las campa√±as y maximizar el retorno de la inversi√≥n.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
StubHub International (SHI) is a marketplace that provides fans a safe, transparent, and trusted environment to buy and sell tickets for sport and music events all over the world. It allows fans with tickets they can no longer use to recoup part of the money they‚Äôve spent and fans that didn‚Äôt have the chance to buy tickets during the on-sale, to access them at any time. Our Purpose: To bring the joy of live to fans globally.




At StubHub International, we are:




We put our fans first: A vibrant marketplace needs to earn and keep the trust of Fans - our buyers. We prioritise and work backwards from the Fan, with the conviction that a high trust Fan experience will serve the best interests of sellers and our business in the long-term.
We are one team with a purpose: We are stronger together. We collaborate in pursuit of ambitious shared purpose and goals. We empower others to respectfully challenge ideas when they disagree. We debate, decide, and commit.
We deliver: We are empowered to make data-driven decisions and take action. We balance quality, effort and speed. We seize opportunities, overcome obstacles and find solutions. We accept full ownership of our commitments and trust others to achieve theirs.
We are diverse & inclusive: We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace represents the world we live in, provides an environment for multiple perspectives to be considered, and helps us serve our customers better. We seek to understand and respect others regardless of their background or position.




The opportunity:




As a Data Analyst you will be responsible for building data models, developing and maintaining attribution models, evaluating campaign performance, and managing our Google Analytics platform. This role requires a self-starter who can work with minimal supervision and deliver high-quality results. Additionally, you will be expected to effectively communicate with stakeholders, support other business areas, and organise work within an Agile framework.




Key Responsibilities:




Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track marketing performance using Tableau or similar visualisation tools.
Build and optimise marketing models, including attribution models, to evaluate campaign effectiveness and maintain their accuracy and relevance.
Manage and enhance our Google Analytics platform to ensure accurate tracking and reporting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data needs and provide analytical support across different areas of the business.
Utilize SQL and BigQuery for data extraction and manipulation.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders to understand their requirements and present findings clearly.
Organize and manage tasks in an Agile environment, participating in sprint planning, stand-ups, and retrospectives.




Requirements:




2-3 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a marketing context.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data warehouses like BigQuery.
Proven experience building dashboards and visualisations (Tableau preferred, but other tools like Power BI or Looker are acceptable).
Familiarity with Google Analytics or other marketing analytics tools.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience organising work and managing projects within an Agile framework.




Preferred Qualifications:




Experience with dbt for data transformation and modelling.
Understanding of digital marketing and campaign performance metrics.
Prior experience in an international company or working with diverse teams.




What we offer:




¬∑ We embrace 100% remote working and hybrid working models.

¬∑ Competitive salary.

¬∑ Good work environment is very important for us.

¬∑ Cultural diversity and international teams.

¬∑ Benefits: private medical insurance (you and your direct family), life insurance, pension plan, meal tickets, public transport pass, nursery tickets, time off and others.




Are you interested in joining an ambitious and close-knit team dedicated to solving meaningful customer problems? Your work will have a significant impact on the business, and help spread the joy of concerts, theatre, and sports around the world.




We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn‚Äôt just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel StubHub International is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work.

We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn‚Äôt just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ETG has developed into a global player with a presence in 48 countries, spanning 6 continents.

The Group has a diverse portfolio of expertise across various industries, encompassing agricultural inputs, logistics, merchandising, food processing, Energy, Minerals and Metals, Technology, and supply chain optimization.




ETG‚Äôs 8 verticals are structured in a manner to emphasize focus and optimize strategic growth opportunities. We adapt and grow responsibly as a diversified enterprise, creating a sustainable future for all our stakeholders.




Over 7000 employees contribute every day to achieve our vision and purpose and live our values (Respect, Integrity, Pursuit of Excellence, Leadership, and Meritocracy)




ETG Commodities

ETG Commodities trade on various exchanges, where liquid derivative instruments are used to mitigate price risk within the commodities value chain. We pride ourselves in being Agricultural Commodity Specialists and have diversified our portfolio to include Metals and Energy. Core to our business is Africa, where the vertical can leverage off of the group's vast asset base. Our African Footprint encompasses Sub-Saharan and West African countries, with international specialist operations in Central Asia, India, Asia Pacific, and Europe. To understand complexities and embrace opportunities in the markets we operate in, we emphasize building strong, experienced local teams to drive value. They work closely with our suppliers and customers to provide an ecosystem with various product offerings to support operational requirements.




This role would be ideal for someone who has worked in the Agri Commodity space.




ETG is seeking a Data analyst / Data scientist:

Good knowledge of Excel is of priority ( all ‚Äì formulas, pivot tables, etc), including VBA programming skills ‚Äì we need to transfer old written code into new system,
Other programs of Microsoft ‚Äì Power Bi, Power Query, Power Automate,
Database maintenance ( understanding the concept of databases). Database languages : Phyton, SQL, C++. Web languages ‚Äì is a plus.
Handling unstructured data,
Web scrapping / hacking skills,
Business intelligence.




Education: Bachelor / master‚Äôs degree in engineering or computer science, or statistics / mathematics & forecasting.

Experience: 1-2 year ( at least internship program) in commodities, or logistics, operations, supply chain management.

Languages : good command of English.

Title: Data Analyst - Customer Interactions
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Data Analyst team of Customer Interactions and Monetization Tribe.




The responsibility of this team is to support business in their analytical needs, through descriptive analytics and diagnosis, generating insights and recommendations that support better decision making and derives in greater commercial results.




We are looking for a dynamic and proactive person, who connects successfully with Business areas, understands their needs, their services and products functioning and the data ecosystem, and can generate accurate and meaningful data driven analysis and recommendations.




We expect from you a strong and honest teamwork spirit to create an excellent and collaborative environment with business stakeholders and your Data Analyst teammates, contributing this way to a robust and high skilled data analyst community.




Are you a great team player and like having fun while you are working? Then this is your place.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data Analyst, you will proactively connect Business areas and understand their needs, their services and products functioning and the data ecosystem, and can generate accurate data driven analysis and recommendations, as‚Ä¶




Product analysis trends to increase sales conversion, reduce product attrition, improve digital funnels, support recurrent or ad hoc inbound/ outbound communication campaigns, etc.

Customer analysis to understand customer behavior, customer life time value, determine customer segmentation and create customer evolution forecast.

Support and advice business on their reporting needs and any other analytical need.







What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, or other degree with strong analytical content.

Full proficiency in Excel, SAS and SQL (knowledge of other programming languages such as R or Python will be appreciated).

At least 3-6 years of experience in a comparable role, transforming data to extract key business insights using statistical/analytical concepts.

Your communication skills enable you to work together with many different parties throughout our organization.

Willing and able to learn and to improve your technical and your interpersonal skills.

Customer centric.

Fluent English will be appreciated.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.

Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!

Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.

Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶

Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.

Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!

More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1600 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clints decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At EA, we thrive on outrageous thinking. It‚Äôs the fuel that inspires the best games in the world. We‚Äôre innovators and great storytellers. But it‚Äôs not just about amazing your peers, it‚Äôs about amazing yourself. Take risks. Collaborate with great minds and dare to dream big. Do you want to come with us? Together, we are changing the way millions play every day.

EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform

Are you a dedicated and experienced Data Analyst looking for an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team? We are seeking a talented individual to become a key player in our Loc Data & AI team at Electronic Arts (EA). This role is pivotal to our data-driven decision-making process, where you will analyze data to uncover insights that enhance our gaming.

Responsibilities


Data Analysis: Analyze complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Visualization: Create compelling data visualizations and reports that effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Usability: Design and develop user-friendly dashboards, reports, and tools to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Storytelling: Craft compelling narratives to convey complex data insights and recommendations to various audiences.
Ownership: Deliver end-to-end data projects, from initial data requirements gathering and validation to final analysis and presentation.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business strategies.
Data Quality: Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with organizational standards.
Tool Development: Develop and maintain tools, scripts, and documentation to support data analysis and visualization.


Qualifications And Skills


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field with relevant experience or a Master‚Äôs degree.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in providing valuable insights that have demonstrably enhanced outcomes.
Excellent level of English.
Technical Proficiency:
Microsoft Power BI: Expertise in Power Query M, DAX, dataset modeling, reports, and dashboards design, with the ability to design prototypes to support requirements.
APIs: Understanding of REST APIs and SOAP APIs, with the ability to read and understand technical specifications.
Data Analysis and SQL: Strong expertise in data analysis and SQL programming.
UX/UI Design: Sound knowledge of UX/UI design for analytics solutions.
Version Control and CI/CD: Proficiency with Git and CI/CD (multi-branch approach).
Soft Skills:
Teamwork: Strong team worker with a delivery-focused mindset.
Agile Experience: Experience working within Agile teams.
Stakeholder Communication: Ability to articulate conversations with business stakeholders beyond the technical level discussion of the user stories.
Communication: Robust communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strategic Thinking: Strong strategic and problem-solving skills, with the ability to anticipate potential issues and create effective solutions.
Exceptional ability in data visualization and design, with a focus on crafting compelling data narratives.
Mastery in leveraging Business Intelligence tools to drive data analysis and strategic decision-making.


Connect your future to ours. Inspire. Dream. Play

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Role

Fever is looking for an Analyst that will play a vital role in taking our products to the next level, deepening/ widening our current understanding of our users and identifying improvement opportunities for our product. We're looking for someone with great analysis skills, the ability to get things done and a genuine interest in our customers.

This is the perfect position for someone who knows a variety of techniques and tools related to data analysis (examples of techniques: SQL, clustering, predictive models, pattern recognition, examples of tools: R, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc), enjoys working in a team and loves digging into data to uncover product/business problems and opportunities. You will work closely with different areas of the business. We also value the ability to understand how to prioritize, think on how things will scale, make tradeoffs and balance the business needs with technical constraints .

Key Responsibilities


Working with Business Intelligence teams to define and understand KPIs & Business Goals
Working with Management or Business Intelligence teams to Identify main opportunities
Auditing of current reporting & analytics
Auditing any changes to ensure data accuracy and normalization of data
Working to develop meaningful segmentation models, behavioral analysis of key user segments to analyze churn including elements like origin source, onboarding, plan types and feature retention
Completing critical analysis that will drive growth and provide insights


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree with Engineering/Technical background required.
0-2 Years of relevant experience
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; strong bias towards data-based decision.
To love everything data - designing models, reporting, driving results/growth
Excellent written and spoken English
Good time management skills.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with developers, business owners, and senior business leaders.
High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.


Preferred Qualifications


Top-tier grades
An excellent understanding of SQL or other query languages preferred
Experience in a cross-functional team.
Experience working in agile software development is a plus


BENEFITS


Attractive compensation package
Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
Work in a location in the heart of the city, with possible travel across our markets
Home-office friendly
Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee
English Lessons and Gympass
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow
We have free snacks, drinks and fruit at the office!


Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, we've helped 40+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

  • Mantenimiento de Bases de Datos: Asegurar la integridad y precisi√≥n de los datos en las bases de datos de la empresa.
  • Soporte en la Toma de Decisiones: Proveer soporte anal√≠tico para la toma de decisiones estrat√©gicas relacionadas con la gesti√≥n de alquileres.


¬øQui√©n eres?

  • Educaci√≥n: T√≠tulo universitario en Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Econom√≠a, ADE, Ingenier√≠a, o similar.
  • Experiencia: Al menos 2 a√±os de experiencia en an√°lisis de datos.
  • Dominio de herramientas de an√°lisis de datos como Excel, SQL y software de visualizaci√≥n de datos (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
  • Conocimientos b√°sicos de lenguajes de programaci√≥n como Python o R (deseable).
  • Excelentes habilidades anal√≠ticas y de resoluci√≥n de problemas.
  • Capacidad para trabajar con grandes conjuntos de datos y extraer informaci√≥n relevante.
  • Buenas habilidades de comunicaci√≥n para presentar hallazgos y recomendaciones de manera clara y concisa.
  • Atenci√≥n al detalle y capacidad para trabajar en un entorno din√°mico.


¬øQu√© te ofrecemos?

Desarrollo profesional en una de las scaleups de mayor crecimiento en Europa y LATAM.

Formar parte de un equipo ambicioso orientado a la excelencia en los resultados.

Salario competitivo y acorde a tus competencias.

Posibilidad de cobrar tu salario cuando quieras o marcarte planes de ahorro.

Alianza con Clicars: podr√°s beneficiarte de descuentos para la compra de coches.

Adem√°s, por ser empleado de Clikalia tambi√©n contamos con descuentos en la compra de viviendas y en el asesoramiento y gesti√≥n hipotecaria.


En Clikalia queremos integrar el mejor equipo para seguir cambiando, con tecnolog√≠a y transparencia, la forma en la que se hacen las cosas en torno a algo tan esencial como la vivienda.

En cumplimiento de la normativa de protecci√≥n de datos Clipiso Desarrollo S.L.U. como responsable del tratamiento te informa que los datos ser√°n tratados con la finalidad de gestionar la oferta de empleo dentro del Grupo Clikalia. La base del tratamiento es el establecimiento de la relaci√≥n contractual. Los datos no ser√°n conservados una vez finalizada la selecci√≥n. En caso de contrataci√≥n, los datos formar√°n parte del expediente profesional. Los datos podr√°n ser cedidos a sociedades del Grupo para la gesti√≥n. No est√°n previstas transferencias internacionales. Puede ejercitar sus derechos de acceso, rectificaci√≥n, supresi√≥n, portabilidad y la limitaci√≥n u oposici√≥n dirigi√©ndose por escrito a dpo@clikalia.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
√önete como Data Analyst a una compa√±√≠a de elevada reputaci√≥n en el sector del comercio omnicanal, donde tu principal misi√≥n ser√° desarrollar e implementar soluciones de anal√≠tica de datos, asegurando su calidad y trazabilidad, y facilitando el acceso a conjuntos de datos que generen impacto en todas las √°reas de la compa√±√≠a.



¬øCu√°les ser√°n tus principales responsabilidades?

Implementar la estrategia de construcci√≥n del marco de datos de la compa√±√≠a, garantizando la calidad y trazabilidad de los datos.
Definir indicadores y ratios en colaboraci√≥n con los equipos de negocio.
Evaluar soluciones de anal√≠tica y partnerships para proporcionar una ventaja competitiva.
Apoyar a los equipos de business analysts en la construcci√≥n de insights de negocio.
Inspeccionar, limpiar, transformar y modelar datos. Explorar y analizar fuentes de datos complejas.
Crear y poner en producci√≥n datasets.
Definir y analizar KPIs.
Mejorar herramientas anal√≠ticas como dashboards y reportes.
Implementar soluciones anal√≠ticas corporativas para los equipos de negocio.




¬øQue esperamos de ti?

M√°s de 3 a√±os de experiencia como Data Analyst o en roles similares y conocimientos de negocio.
Nociones de Cloud Data Warehouses/Data Lakes.
Experiencia en la construcci√≥n de reportes y dashboards.
Conocimientos avanzados de SQL (BigQuery).
Competencia en herramientas de visualizaci√≥n de datos (Looker, PowerBI, Looker Studio).
Ofim√°tica a nivel avanzado.
Nivel alto de ingl√©s.

¬øQue ofrecemos?

Ambiente laboral din√°mico y colaborativo con oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.
Contrato indefinido con remuneraci√≥n competitiva acorde a la experiencia y responsabilidades.
Horario de trabajo flexible para promover el equilibrio entre vida laboral y personal.
Formaci√≥n continua y acceso a recursos de aprendizaje.

Si est√°s listo para asumir este reto y llevar tu carrera al siguiente nivel, ¬°queremos conocerte!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are




At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of AON, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




About the role




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. In this role, you will deliver strategic analysis on high priority initiatives across the entire organization. You will be working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales, and Operations in providing them with visibility to real-time data. You will be expected to deliver data-driven insights that will play an integral role in defining the company‚Äôs data model.




A typical day




Use Looker to build critical dashboards that will measure business performance, hold teams accountable, and generate insights.
Democratize data through skillful data structuring by developing Looker explores to support our internal stakeholders.
Own data analysis and visualization, and communicate the outcomes/insights to various stakeholders that will be utilized to make strategic decisions for improvements.
Partner with the Analytics and Data Engineering teams to understand current problems with our existing data platform, identity solutions, and deliver high quality data foundations to data stakeholders across multiple business lines.
Work cross-functionally with Product, Sales, Operations, and Marketing to provide them with visibility to real-time data on existing and new processes.




What you need to succeed




About 2 - 4 years of experience in a data analyst role.
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative field.
Highly proficient in SQL
Experience using visualization tools, preferably Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience working in Agile environments, preferably with Jira.
Extra Credit - Exposure to data modeling and transformation tools like dbt and experience with data analysis and building data pipelines with Python.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
Hability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong quantitative reasoning skills and experience using data to provide insights to executive leadership and other departments.




About the recruitment process




Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let‚Äôs move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the leaders from our amazing Data Analytics Team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day and their responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Analyst as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level on SQL and you will have a maximum of 4 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet our Head of Data, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet




At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations. And just for good measure‚Ä¶




üí∞ Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
‚è∞ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it‚Äôs up to you!
üéÅ Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
üìö Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500‚Ç¨ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
üõí Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
üèù 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
üçè Great office in Madrid, where you will find all the coffee, drinks, snacks and fruit you want. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Title: BI Analyst - Data Visualization
Description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

Fever is looking for an Analyst that will play a vital role in taking our products to the next level, deepening/ widening our current understanding of our users and identifying improvement opportunities for our product. We're looking for someone with great analysis skills, the ability to get things done and a genuine interest in our customers.

This is the perfect position for someone who knows a variety of techniques and tools related to data analysis (examples of techniques: SQL, clustering, predictive models, pattern recognition, examples of tools: R, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc), enjoys working in a team and loves digging into data to uncover product/business problems and opportunities. You will work closely with different areas of the business. We also value the ability to understand how to prioritize, think on how things will scale, make tradeoffs and balance the business needs with technical constraints .

Key Responsibilities


Create new visualizations according to all Fever teams needs and new requests
Optimize and maintain all those visualizations
Fully understand Fever's data model to be on top on new visualization requests and study their viability
Fully understand existing visualizations for all teams to be in charge of responding doubts and new requests via the corresponding channels for each team
Be proactive to create new visualizations and to improve our existing data model
Understand our data hierarchy and security levels for each team


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree with Engineering/Technical background required.
+2 years of experience in MicroStrategy, only experience with MicroStrategy will be considered (no other visualization tools).
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; strong bias towards data-based decision.
To love everything data - designing models, reporting, driving results/growth
Excellent written and spoken English
Good time management skills.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with developers, business owners, and senior business leaders.
High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.


Preferred Qualifications


Top-tier grades
An excellent understanding of SQL or other query languages preferred
Experience in a cross-functional team.
Experience working in agile software development is a plus


BENEFITS


Attractive compensation package
Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
Work in a location in the heart of the city, with possible travel across our markets
Home-office friendly
Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee
English Lessons and Gympass
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow
We have free snacks, drinks and fruit at the office!


Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!
Show more
HTML:
ABOUT THE ROLE

Fever is looking for an Analyst that will play a vital role in taking our products to the next level, deepening/ widening our current understanding of our users and identifying improvement opportunities for our product. We're looking for someone with great analysis skills, the ability to get things done and a genuine interest in our customers.

This is the perfect position for someone who knows a variety of techniques and tools related to data analysis (examples of techniques: SQL, clustering, predictive models, pattern recognition, examples of tools: R, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc), enjoys working in a team and loves digging into data to uncover product/business problems and opportunities. You will work closely with different areas of the business. We also value the ability to understand how to prioritize, think on how things will scale, make tradeoffs and balance the business needs with technical constraints .

Key Responsibilities

  • Create new visualizations according to all Fever teams needs and new requests
  • Optimize and maintain all those visualizations
  • Fully understand Fever's data model to be on top on new visualization requests and study their viability
  • Fully understand existing visualizations for all teams to be in charge of responding doubts and new requests via the corresponding channels for each team
  • Be proactive to create new visualizations and to improve our existing data model
  • Understand our data hierarchy and security levels for each team

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree with Engineering/Technical background required.
  • +2 years of experience in MicroStrategy, only experience with MicroStrategy will be considered (no other visualization tools).
  • Strong analytical and quantitative skills; strong bias towards data-based decision.
  • To love everything data - designing models, reporting, driving results/growth
  • Excellent written and spoken English
  • Good time management skills.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with developers, business owners, and senior business leaders.
  • High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Top-tier grades
  • An excellent understanding of SQL or other query languages preferred
  • Experience in a cross-functional team.
  • Experience working in agile software development is a plus

BENEFITS

  • Attractive compensation package
  • Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
  • 40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
  • Work in a location in the heart of the city, with possible travel across our markets
  • Home-office friendly
  • Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
  • Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
  • Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee
  • English Lessons and Gympass
  • Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow
  • We have free snacks, drinks and fruit at the office!

Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, we've helped 40+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

  • Experiencia utilizando Data Ware House y las tablas de hechos y de dimensiones.

  • Ingl√©s: B2

Title: Junior EMEA Regional Data Analyst
Description:
Services_EMEA-E484

Junior EMEA Regional Data Analyst - Full Time - Madrid, Spain

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

To support the business by maintaining databases, executing and delivering daily reports, designing and/or recommending new tools, training and supporting end-users and maintaining system protocols by writing and updating procedures and documenting tools.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


To support his/her superior in the analysis and presentation of ‚ÄúRegional Data‚Äù
To maintain on daily basis the business data bases ensuring the correctness of the data by performing sanity checks.
To execute and deliver daily reports supporting functional heads to manage their region including maintaining reports documentation.
To participate in the design of new tools by analysing business requirements including writing specifications and documentation of the tools, supporting the development project team by identifying project milestones and establishing and/or monitoring the project progress and Budget
To perform ad-hoc reports and analysis by gathering and analyzing relevant information and evaluating the output requirements and formats.
To recommend controls by identifying data management problems and developing improvement procedures.
To participate in the ERP and tools councils acting as a moderator to the end-users.
To support end-users acting as a trainer and/or consultant providing help desk support.
To keep information confidential.
All other duties as relevant to the post


To succeed in this role, you will need:


Highly numerical and analytical skills.
Highly Excel Skills.
QlikSense or Power BI knowledge.
SQL Knowledge.
BI and / or Data Science experience.
Ideally some operational experience.
Ideally some ERP (SAP and / or D365) experience.
Sound verbal and written English communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group.
Drive for results.
Managing purpose and motivating others.
Ensuring accountability and integrity.
Customer dedication.
Business orientation.
Functional/Technical competency.
Keeping confidentiality


What we offer you:


A competitive salary as well as participation in the variable remuneration system based on personal and financial objectives.
Restaurant tickets.
Permanent contract.
Accident insurance.
Working from home according to local policy.


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2024 in Brazil, China, Germany, Switzerland, the United Kingdom and the United States.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About WOW:

We‚Äôre WOW, a ground-breaking concept connecting forward-thinking brands and people at the intersection of online along with offline. We‚Äôre here for the crazy ones, the early adopters, the ones who see things differently, seeking to experiment, try new things and open to being surprised. People come to WOW to see and discover what‚Äôs new & happening, hence discovering our exclusive and curated brand assortment. In short, WOW is a phygital platform that combines unique physical locations and an online marketplace (WOWconcept.com) as well as partners with Direct to Consumer and established brands to create unique phygital experiences. With a customer centric approach, our goal is to constantly surprise our clients with outstanding customer experiences plus carefully curated brand selection, which can be described as follows: New, Hard to find, Trendy, Exclusive, Desirable and Forward-thinking. Launched in 2020, we started by opening our first physical store in the heart of Madrid. The store is an 8 floor and 5.500 sqm building located at the city center in Gran Via, 18. Now we have made a strategic decision: to stay with the commercial artery of the capital by opening soon our second store, a 9 floor building located at Serrano 52. If there is one thing that was plain to us from the beginning, it was that our success depends on our people and that is why since the start we have worked to define our values, values that are present in everything we do: customer focus, ‚Äúall for one‚Äù, passion and integrity. WOW is a brand-new company, yet full of great, agile, and enthusiastic professionals who drive it as a team in a single direction: to revolutionize retail.




What will you do:

Analyze the performance of Marketing campaigns and conversion rate based on KPIs to evaluate their effectiveness.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track marketing results using visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or similar.
Monitor and analyze sales trends to identify patterns and new growth opportunities.
Work with the Marketing team to develop strategies based on previously collected data.
Regularly evaluate data analysis tools and processes to ensure they are best suited to the company's current needs.
Interpret large volumes of data, identify trends, detect problems and propose data-driven solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data needs and provide analytical support in different areas of the business.




Who you are

Highly motivated, detail oriented, organized, with strong communication skills, familiar with a team environment.




The experience you bring

Industrial Engineer, Degree in Business Administration, Mathematics or any quantitative field.
At least 3 years of experience in data analysis.
Proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Ads, Power BI.
Knowledge of Tableau, SQL, Looker, Qlik and similar will be an asset. As well as Python, R or other scripting languages.
Experience in retail/ecommerce is an asset.
Fluency in Spanish and English.
Proactive, organized, methodical and able to present data and explain complex concepts easily.




What we offer

All for one, one for all is part of our DNA, therefore, you will have the opportunity to:

Contribute to the growth of a company with a very big ambition at a very early stage.
Join a company where people come first in a young and unbeatable work dynamic, an environment and a great talent where we really live our values.
Permanent contract.
Competitive fixed salary.
Flexible remuneration (Cobee).
Medical insurance.
Other benefits.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Retail Media
Description:
En Auren Personas trabajamos desde la divisi√≥n de Selecci√≥n & Executive Search y nos dedicamos a proporcionar servicios especializados de consultor√≠a de Recursos Humanos.

Dise√±o y desarrollo de cuadros, reportes espec√≠ficos, de performance y de posicionamiento/insights.




Requisitos:

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure (better known as Securitas Direct in Spain) is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate Data Analyst to join our Supply Chain & Procurement team and work both globally and locally. This is a position where you will have chance to impact and help drive Verisure‚Äôs growth.




Our success depends on our people and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.







Location




The position is based in Madrid.







Key Responsibilities




Data Analysis: define, collect and aggregate business data to make fact-based decisions.
Build, develop and maintain dashboards and reports in partnership with stakeholders across the function.
Provide analytical answers to strategic questions about procurement & supply chain processes, including advanced reporting, enterprise data analysis, and data management
Business Follow up: Monitor procurement plans, identifying potential savings, and assessing their impact on business plans




Qualifications:




Proven experience (3 - 5 years) in data modelling, analysis and reporting

Entrepreneurial and committed, with a strong hands-on approach
Strong interpersonal skills and experience working in an international, multicultural setting
Structured, detail oriented, and capable of understanding the big picture
Strong and proactive analytic and problem-solving skills
Driven with a great people and motivational skills
Impact-oriented with a focus on impact measurement
Strong written and oral communication capabilities for creating content and presenting, as well as writing, more technical queries and reports
Good understanding of data modelling and queries and DAX programming languages
Ability to create best-practice reports (e.g. Power BI reports) based on data mining, analysis, and visualization.
Complementary programming languages like Python, R
Ideally complementary knowledge of supply chain, procurement & finance processes







The Company




We Are People Who Protect People

We are the leading provider of professionally monitored alarms for residential households and small businesses in Europe.




Peace of mind for families and small businesses

We believe it is a human right to feel safe and secure. We now protect more than 3.4 million families and small businesses. Our service includes 24/7 monitoring, expert verification and response, customer care, service and maintenance services, and professional technical support. As well as protecting against intrusion, we protect against fire, attack, theft, life-threatening emergencies and other hazards. Verisure people are dedicated and committed and provide what we believe is the best customer service in the industry.




Leading across a broad footprint

We are the leading provider of residential and small business monitored alarms in Europe. We operate in 16 countries across Europe and Latin America. Our business is driven by organic growth, based on our differentiated business model. We attract high quality customers. We work hard to ensure that our customers are happy. This contributes to an industry leading level of attrition and a long customer lifetime.




A technology-enabled human services company

Our 18,000 team-mates are the foundation of our company. Our business model combines technology and human expertise to protect people. We are a human services company. More than 80% of our colleagues interact with customers every day. This connection provides the insight that inspires our innovation. These insights are a source of advantage. We leverage these insights with the significant investment we make into product and service innovation. The close customer contact also fuels the pride which drives engagement.




30 years of experience ‚Äì and many more to come

We have been protecting what matters most since 1988. Over that time, we have expanded beyond our roots in the Nordics and Spain. We now serve most of Europe and have also established a strong presence in Latin America. In 2017, to evolve our operating model, strategic innovation, operational excellence and access to talent, we opened our new Group headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland. In 2019, we formed a strategic partnership with Arlo, a world leader in connected cameras. Verisure acquired all rights to Arlo‚Äôs European business. This allows us to offer connected camera services in Europe as a complement to our professionally monitored security service. It also allows us to access new go-to-market opportunities in retail and e-commerce.




Our winning DNA




Everything we do is driven by our DNA. Our DNA has enabled us to grow at a double-digit pace for many years and is setting us up to continue this journey.




Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.
Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.
Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.
Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.
With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.
Show more
HTML:
Verisure (better known as Securitas Direct in Spain) is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate Data Analyst to join our Supply Chain & Procurement team and work both globally and locally. This is a position where you will have chance to impact and help drive Verisure‚Äôs growth.


Our success depends on our people and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.



Location


The position is based in Madrid.



Key Responsibilities


  • Data Analysis: define, collect and aggregate business data to make fact-based decisions.
  • Build, develop and maintain dashboards and reports in partnership with stakeholders across the function.
  • Provide analytical answers to strategic questions about procurement & supply chain processes, including advanced reporting, enterprise data analysis, and data management
  • Business Follow up: Monitor procurement plans, identifying potential savings, and assessing their impact on business plans


Qualifications:


Proven experience (3 - 5 years) in data modelling, analysis and reporting

  • Entrepreneurial and committed, with a strong hands-on approach
  • Strong interpersonal skills and experience working in an international, multicultural setting
  • Structured, detail oriented, and capable of understanding the big picture
  • Strong and proactive analytic and problem-solving skills
  • Driven with a great people and motivational skills
  • Impact-oriented with a focus on impact measurement
  • Strong written and oral communication capabilities for creating content and presenting, as well as writing, more technical queries and reports
  • Good understanding of data modelling and queries and DAX programming languages
  • Ability to create best-practice reports (e.g. Power BI reports) based on data mining, analysis, and visualization.
  • Complementary programming languages like Python, R
  • Ideally complementary knowledge of supply chain, procurement & finance processes



The Company

Title: BUSINESS DATA ANALYST (REMOTE)
Description:
BUSINESS DATA ANALYST (REMOTE)

Portuguese consultancy hires for Hybrid work from Madrid (3 times per week at the client's office)

Applicants must live in Madrid

ONLY RESUMES IN ENGLISH WILL BE ACCEPTED

Mandatory Skills


5+ years working as a Business Data Analyst / Business Analyst
Background on Management is highly valued
Previous exposure to Data projects within the domains of Accounting and Financial Planning & Analysis


Role Description Skills


Data Architecture / Data Modelling knowledge
Python Programming for Data
Expert in Data Analysis / SQL Programming
Understanding of REST APIs / SOAP APIs ( ability to read/understand technical specifications)
Experienced in Microsoft Power BI (ability to design prototypes to support requirements)
For the financial √°rea


Responsibilities


Mainly responsible for Business requirement gathering, User Story writing, and leading User Story refinement / Solution design efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery
Proactively capture and understand Business processes and suggest improvements to the Data Platform that benefit the organization


Soft Skills


Fluent in English (Writing, Reading, Speaking)
Team worker
Delivery focused mindset
Experience in working within Agile Teams
Expert communicator with Business Stakeholders
Ability to translate requirements to team engineers at a technical level
Act as Data Platform evangelist in the organization and assume a deputy Product owner role

Title: Staff Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be office-based, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK.

Drive Strategic Decisions. Shape Our Future. The Data Department is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As a Staff Data Analyst supporting the Finance, Legal, and Strategy (FLS) team at Personio, you play a pivotal role in transforming data into strategic insights, shaping our company‚Äôs financial strategy. In this role, you're not just analyzing numbers; you're driving critical business decisions and influencing long-term strategies. Your insights directly impact our financial health and strategic direction, making your contribution vital to our mission of sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Business Partnership: Act as a primary data strategist for the organization, partnering with top executives. Regularly consult with the CFO and other executives, providing data-driven guidance on major strategic initiatives and long-term planning.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret diverse datasets, focusing on financial performance, legal trends, and strategic initiatives to guide FLS in making informed, data-driven decisions.
Dashboard Development: Create and strategize the evolution of real-time, interactive dashboards for stakeholders, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
Business Reviews and Insight Generation: Oversee the insight generation process for business reviews at a company-wide level, guiding analysts in different departments to highlight crucial insights and trends.
Strategic Planning: Collaborate with leadership and peers in developing business strategies grounded in data insights, aimed at growth, operational optimization, and cost reduction.
Stakeholder Management: Lead multiple projects simultaneously, managing expectations and collaborating with the data team for internal consistency, scalability, and reliability of data practices.
Proactive Team Embedding: Act as a strategic data partner for multiple teams, guiding them in aligning their objectives with data insights. Lead initiatives to use data in solving complex business challenges.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Education & Experience: A quantitative degree (e.g., Applied Math, Econ, Stats, Eng, CS) paired with a minimum of 7 years of data analytics experience, in a SaaS, Subscription, or B2B environment with a focus on Finance, Legal, and Strategy. Experience working with executive-level stakeholders (CFO, CEO, ‚Ä¶).
Deep understanding of SaaS-specific financial processes and financial systems like Salesforce, Chargebee, Adaptive.
KPI and Dashboard Expertise: Strong understanding of financial and strategic KPIs and proficient in creating scalable dashboards that effectively translate business requirements into impactful visuals.
Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL and BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, facilitating data extraction, manipulation, and presentation.
Statistical Knowledge: Master the use of cutting-edge statistical methods and tools, providing strategic guidance and recommendations based on sophisticated data analysis.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve deep into data, identifying underlying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex data observations in simple terms, ensuring clarity and understanding among stakeholders. Master the art of storytelling with data, driving organizational change and strategy through powerful presentations and reports.
Entrepreneurial Approach: A proactive problem-solver, focused on generating impactful results and identifying opportunities for improvement through data-driven insights.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Benefits

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package ‚Äì reevaluated each year ‚Äì that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
Make an impact on the environment and society with 2 (fully paid) Impact Days ‚Äì one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! Most teams offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework
Invest in your development with an annual personal development budget to use on professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and more
Connect with your fellow Personios at regular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrations
Engage in a high-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes


About Us

Bring your best. Make your mark. We‚Äôre using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let‚Äôs build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.
Show more

Title: Junior EMEA Regional Data Analyst
Description:
Services_EMEA-E484

Junior EMEA Regional Data Analyst - Full Time - Madrid, Spain

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

To support the business by maintaining databases, executing and delivering daily reports, designing and/or recommending new tools, training and supporting end-users and maintaining system protocols by writing and updating procedures and documenting tools.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


To support his/her superior in the analysis and presentation of ‚ÄúRegional Data‚Äù
To maintain on daily basis the business data bases ensuring the correctness of the data by performing sanity checks.
To execute and deliver daily reports supporting functional heads to manage their region including maintaining reports documentation.
To participate in the design of new tools by analysing business requirements including writing specifications and documentation of the tools, supporting the development project team by identifying project milestones and establishing and/or monitoring the project progress and Budget
To perform ad-hoc reports and analysis by gathering and analyzing relevant information and evaluating the output requirements and formats.
To recommend controls by identifying data management problems and developing improvement procedures.
To participate in the ERP and tools councils acting as a moderator to the end-users.
To support end-users acting as a trainer and/or consultant providing help desk support.
To keep information confidential.
All other duties as relevant to the post


To succeed in this role, you will need:


Highly numerical and analytical skills.
Highly Excel Skills.
QlikSense or Power BI knowledge.
SQL Knowledge.
BI and / or Data Science experience.
Ideally some operational experience.
Ideally some ERP (SAP and / or D365) experience.
Sound verbal and written English communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group.
Drive for results.
Managing purpose and motivating others.
Ensuring accountability and integrity.
Customer dedication.
Business orientation.
Functional/Technical competency.
Keeping confidentiality


What we offer you:


A competitive salary as well as participation in the variable remuneration system based on personal and financial objectives.
Restaurant tickets.
Permanent contract.
Accident insurance.
Working from home according to local policy.


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2024 in Brazil, China, Germany, Switzerland, the United Kingdom and the United States.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
MSX IBERIA is looking for a Data Analyst to join our great team.

The main goal of our future analyst is to analyze large datasets to extract valuable information and generate insights that can drive strategic decision-making.

Do you think you could be a good fit? Then keep reading!

Functions and Responsibilities:


Obtain data from various sources and prepare it for analysis, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Utilize tools to design charts, tables, and dashboards that help effectively represent the data.
Interpret patterns and trends found in the data, identifying insights and making decisions based on them.
Explain the results through reports and presentations that assist decision-making within the organization.
Ensure that visualizations and dashboards are up-to-date and relevant as data and business needs evolve.



Madrid-Spain

We are looking for you if:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Informatics, or a related field.
Experience with tools like Databricks and Tableau is a plus.
At least 2 years of experience in data analytics, including structuring data from various sources.
Demonstrated ability to generate performance reports and conduct trend analysis.
Experience in identifying variations and special causes in the data.



What do we offer you?


You will be part of a great team of professionals in an internationally consolidated company.
You will acquire a global vision of the automotive sector, interacting with customers, suppliers, consultants and dealers.
Competitive salary.
MSX Bazaar: Collective purchasing portal with great discounts for employees.
22 working days according to collective bargaining agreement + 4 extra days.
Internal training plan.
Additional incentives for employee referral programs, internal trainers, new business opportunities.



Do you think you are the ideal person for this position? We want to meet you! Sign up for the offer quickly and we'll review your application.

About MSX:

With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:


Consumer Engagement
Parts, Accessories & Service Performance
Actionable Insights
Diagnostics & Repair Enhancement
Warranty and Repair Efficiency
Technical Information
Learning Solutions
Sales Performance



Building trust since 1931, our proven track record means that we now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.

The MSXI Purpose

To empower Movers and Makers to thrive in our ever-changing world

The MSXI Mission

To harness our expertise in mobility, the creativity of our global teams,

and the power of technology, to craft tailored and innovative solutions

The MSXI Vision

To enhance every journey in the world of mobility

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.
