Title: Junior Business Insights and Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Business Environment

The Customer Support & Services Delivery (CSSD) Business Insights and Analytics is team within Digital and Transformation Organization focused on supporting CSSD Businesses with data, reports and insights to improve Customer experience and drive operational excellence through the right set of actionable metrics to accelerate innovation and transformation, in this case is specifically supporting Customer Care Center Organization.

Job Summary

This role is responsible for collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data to support decision-making and provide insights to the organization. The role works with large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations, helping businesses make informed choices and optimize their operations. The role utilizes various tools, techniques, and analytical skills to extract meaningful information from data and communicate their findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Responsibilities


Understanding business requirements, creating reports, analytics and business intelligence
Works with global reporting teams to set up and adapt standard reporting, based on business requirements.
Works together with Customer Care Center teams/internal customers to capture and met business requirements
Create reports and business intelligence to better understand operational performance of our Contact Centers
Provides insight on call drivers and customer satisfaction drivers
Analyze ways to avoid calls by providing solutions on the web
Identifies anomalies in data to enable issue prevention
Optimization and standardization
Identify improvement opportunities


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Work experience is not required, but appropriate internships related to the job content would be a plus.


Preferred Certifications


Programming Language/s Certification (SQL, Python, or similar)


Knowledge And Skills


Data Analysis, Data Management, Data Modeling, Data Quality, Data Science, Data Visualization and Data Warehousing
Using data collection and analysis tools and software packages to gather, integrate and analyze data from multiple sources.
Strong analytical, statistical and problem solving skills.
Understanding of industry quality standards and methodologies.
Using empirical and root- cause analysis, modeling, and testing methodologies to identify areas for process improvement.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English.
Ability to effectively communicate plans, proposals, and results, and negotiate options at different levels.


What We Offer


Opportunity to work in an international organization with colleagues coming from all over the world.
Diverse, continued internal growth and career opportunities. Including HP‚Äôs own learning platform and LinkedIn Learning.
An attractive benefits package:
Health & Life insurance
Lunch at reduced prices at our canteen/ ticket restaurant vouchers
HP product discount
Work life balance / flexible working hours.
Women, Pride, Young employees, Sustainability and DisAbility! Just a few of our fantastic global business networks you can get involved with locally.
We also dedicate time and resources to contribute with our community through Corporate Volunteering activities, including our onsite HP Charity day.
Do you like to give back to the community? Then join one of our many volunteering teams or be a part of the incredible HP charity day held on site annually.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor) with 25+ regular coordinated‚ÄØactivities.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy, and general health.
Printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on‚ÄØworkshops‚ÄØto print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models.
Dedicated lactation room.
Our Women Network organizes activities such as Networking, the promotion of STEM vocations, talks on, improving business acumen, work life balance and skills of the future, etc.

Sounds like you? Apply and let‚Äôs have a talk!

Title: Climate Data Analyst
Description:
Climate Data Specialist, Zurich Resilience Solutions, 80%-100%

At Zurich Resilience Solutions (ZRS) we‚Äôre committed to supporting our customers and business partners through harnessing the expertise in our global network.

We have a brand new role to help shape and grow our business which is going from strength to strength.

Your role in our Climate Resilience team is to support in the development, and deployment of state-of-the-art risk assessment methods and tools. In this role you will be working closely with customer facing business units as well as internal technical functions within Zurich Insurance (e.g. Group Accumulation Management, Group Re, Commercial Insurance Underwriting) towards sourcing and developing climate data and tools for our customers. Your core responsibility in this role is to source, analyze, and visualize data sets (hazard, exposures, controls) to support in the assessment of natural hazards and climate change risks.

What You Will Do

As a Climate Data Specialist your main responsibilities will involve:

Technical Developments


Support the development and continuous update of climate and natural hazards data
Monitor global sustainability regulations and frameworks to identify needs in terms of climate data and develop these.
Support in the development of data processing and visualization tools


Customer Projects


Source and analyse data from internal and open-source databases.
Transform natural hazard and climate change exposure data into key messages and insights/conclusions to help customers build climate change resilience.


Communication


Creation, maintenance and internal sharing of natural hazard and climate change training and knowledge content
Facilitate climate data knowledge sharing across the CCRS community, as well as other internal stakeholders and customers


What You Bring

As Climate Data Specialist your skills and qualifications will ideally include:


Master‚Äôs degree in natural/environmental/atmospheric sciences.
Deep understanding of Climate Change and Natural Hazards science, models, and their practical implementation.
Experience in spatial data management, climate data, spatial analysis, and visualization, big datasets, transforming data into insights for decision-making.
The ability to clearly communicate complicated concepts in a concise and compelling manner to all levels of management and stakeholders of various levels of technical proficiency.
High level of proficiency in data analytics and tools for visualization of spatial data and software, e.g. Power BI, ArcGIS, and programming languages (R, Python, etc.).
Fluent in written and spoken English at a technical level with strong customer service orientation. Any other language is an asset.


Additional Information

We look forward to receiving your online application.

Zurich wants to attract the best talent and we acknowledge that talents might not always be available full-time. At Zurich we will consider requests for flexible working. Many of our employees work flexibly in a variety of ways. Please talk to us during the interview about the flexibility you may need.

Information for recruitment agencies

Zurich does not accept any applications from recruitment agencies for this position. We refuse any responsibility for unsolicited applications as well as any associated fees.

Job Description

Position Summary

This is a position for the Reporting team that is integrated into the KLG FP&A team. Our goal is to give support to our main stakeholders by creating impactful power BI reports and giving analysis that would help and would have a direct impact on business profitability.

Main Responsibilities And Functions

The person in this Data Analyst role will be involved in


Day-to-day modeling, design, and development with Power BI.
You will provide commercial support to Finance and Operations teams (sales and customer care)
Translating business requirements into functional specifications, data source requirements, data extraction and data transformation
Assist in managing projects
Collect and manage a backlog of requirements, to allow the team to deliver business value in every sprint
Work closely with the report owners to test and evaluate the results of your reports


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business administration or Finance
Creative and adaptive mindset
At least 1-3 years of experience in Finance (FP&A, controlling, Finance Businnes Partner)
Experience in BI & analytics projects is desirable.
Knowledge of SQL Server Reporting Services would be a plus
Advanced level of Excel is a must.
Good command of written and spoken English.


Additional Information

The opportunity to develop your skills in an international environment, in the exciting field of language travel

A young and dynamic work atmosphere
An environment where corporate ethics and sustainable development matter
Competitive salary
Lunch vouchers
Free coffee and tea
Free breakfast on Mondays and fresh fruit on Thursdays
Language courses abroad
Medical insurance benefits discounts

Start date: ASAP

Reference: KLG_MKT

Type of contract: Permanent contract with 6 months trial period

Activity rate: Full time

Title: Data Analyst (FP&A)
Description:
Job Purpose:

The newly created role of Data Analyst FP&A has a purpose to support the operations in financial reports deliverables in a good quality and on agreed sequency. The role has also the target to observe and monitor high standards of data quality and alignment between all key financial and analytics systems.

Responsibilities:


Development and design of financial reports and dashboards from multiple sources and systems for operational and business needs (30%)
Preparation and distribution of the reports and analysis in the organization per agreed frequency (30%)
Work on automation and streamlining of the reporting in the organization (20%)
Monitor master data accuracy and alignment in key financial and analytical systems in coordination with the other departments (TDIT, TM1, etc) (20%)


Knowledge, Skills and Experience:


1 to 3 Years of relevant work experience.
Bachelor's Degree with Finance and Accounting field of study required.
Other Education / Certifications: Computer science, IT or Business administration
Able to execute instructions and to request clarification when needed.
Able to recognize and attend to important details with accuracy and efficiency.
Able to communicate clearly and convey necessary information.
Able to converse and write effectively in English
Able to create and conduct formal presentations.
Possesses strong multi-cultural interpersonal skills.
Possesses strong organizational and time management skills, driving tasks to completion.
Able to constructively work under stress and pressure when faced with high workloads and deadlines.
Able to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information
Able to build solid, effective working relationships with others.
Able to quickly learn new systems and technology.
Able to use relevant computer system applications at an advanced level.


What‚Äôs In It For You?


Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It‚Äôs not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.

At TD SYNNEX, we‚Äôre proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you‚Äôre excited about working for our company and believe you‚Äôre a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we‚Äôre looking for!

Title: Staff Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be office-based, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK.

Drive Strategic Decisions. Shape Our Future. The Data Department is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As a Staff Data Analyst supporting the Finance, Legal, and Strategy (FLS) team at Personio, you play a pivotal role in transforming data into strategic insights, shaping our company‚Äôs financial strategy. In this role, you're not just analyzing numbers; you're driving critical business decisions and influencing long-term strategies. Your insights directly impact our financial health and strategic direction, making your contribution vital to our mission of sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Business Partnership: Act as a primary data strategist for the organization, partnering with top executives. Regularly consult with the CFO and other executives, providing data-driven guidance on major strategic initiatives and long-term planning.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret diverse datasets, focusing on financial performance, legal trends, and strategic initiatives to guide FLS in making informed, data-driven decisions.
Dashboard Development: Create and strategize the evolution of real-time, interactive dashboards for stakeholders, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
Business Reviews and Insight Generation: Oversee the insight generation process for business reviews at a company-wide level, guiding analysts in different departments to highlight crucial insights and trends.
Strategic Planning: Collaborate with leadership and peers in developing business strategies grounded in data insights, aimed at growth, operational optimization, and cost reduction.
Stakeholder Management: Lead multiple projects simultaneously, managing expectations and collaborating with the data team for internal consistency, scalability, and reliability of data practices.
Proactive Team Embedding: Act as a strategic data partner for multiple teams, guiding them in aligning their objectives with data insights. Lead initiatives to use data in solving complex business challenges.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Education & Experience: A quantitative degree (e.g., Applied Math, Econ, Stats, Eng, CS) paired with a minimum of 7 years of data analytics experience, in a SaaS, Subscription, or B2B environment with a focus on Finance, Legal, and Strategy. Experience working with executive-level stakeholders (CFO, CEO, ‚Ä¶).
Deep understanding of SaaS-specific financial processes and financial systems like Salesforce, Chargebee, Adaptive.
KPI and Dashboard Expertise: Strong understanding of financial and strategic KPIs and proficient in creating scalable dashboards that effectively translate business requirements into impactful visuals.
Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL and BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, facilitating data extraction, manipulation, and presentation.
Statistical Knowledge: Master the use of cutting-edge statistical methods and tools, providing strategic guidance and recommendations based on sophisticated data analysis.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve deep into data, identifying underlying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex data observations in simple terms, ensuring clarity and understanding among stakeholders. Master the art of storytelling with data, driving organizational change and strategy through powerful presentations and reports.
Entrepreneurial Approach: A proactive problem-solver, focused on generating impactful results and identifying opportunities for improvement through data-driven insights.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Benefits

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package ‚Äì reevaluated each year ‚Äì that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
Make an impact on the environment and society with 2 (fully paid) Impact Days ‚Äì one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! Most teams offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework
Invest in your development with an annual personal development budget to use on professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and more
Connect with your fellow Personios at regular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrations
Engage in a high-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes


About Us

Bring your best. Make your mark. We‚Äôre using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let‚Äôs build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.
Show more
HTML:
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be office-based, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK.

Drive Strategic Decisions. Shape Our Future. The Data Department is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As a Staff Data Analyst supporting the Finance, Legal, and Strategy (FLS) team at Personio, you play a pivotal role in transforming data into strategic insights, shaping our company‚Äôs financial strategy. In this role, you're not just analyzing numbers; you're driving critical business decisions and influencing long-term strategies. Your insights directly impact our financial health and strategic direction, making your contribution vital to our mission of sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do

  • Strategic Business Partnership: Act as a primary data strategist for the organization, partnering with top executives. Regularly consult with the CFO and other executives, providing data-driven guidance on major strategic initiatives and long-term planning.
  • Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret diverse datasets, focusing on financial performance, legal trends, and strategic initiatives to guide FLS in making informed, data-driven decisions.
  • Dashboard Development: Create and strategize the evolution of real-time, interactive dashboards for stakeholders, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
  • Business Reviews and Insight Generation: Oversee the insight generation process for business reviews at a company-wide level, guiding analysts in different departments to highlight crucial insights and trends.
  • Strategic Planning: Collaborate with leadership and peers in developing business strategies grounded in data insights, aimed at growth, operational optimization, and cost reduction.
  • Stakeholder Management: Lead multiple projects simultaneously, managing expectations and collaborating with the data team for internal consistency, scalability, and reliability of data practices.
  • Proactive Team Embedding: Act as a strategic data partner for multiple teams, guiding them in aligning their objectives with data insights. Lead initiatives to use data in solving complex business challenges.

Role Requirements: What you need to succeed

  • Education & Experience: A quantitative degree (e.g., Applied Math, Econ, Stats, Eng, CS) paired with a minimum of 7 years of data analytics experience, in a SaaS, Subscription, or B2B environment with a focus on Finance, Legal, and Strategy. Experience working with executive-level stakeholders (CFO, CEO, ‚Ä¶).
  • Deep understanding of SaaS-specific financial processes and financial systems like Salesforce, Chargebee, Adaptive.
  • KPI and Dashboard Expertise: Strong understanding of financial and strategic KPIs and proficient in creating scalable dashboards that effectively translate business requirements into impactful visuals.
  • Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL and BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, facilitating data extraction, manipulation, and presentation.
  • Statistical Knowledge: Master the use of cutting-edge statistical methods and tools, providing strategic guidance and recommendations based on sophisticated data analysis.
  • Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve deep into data, identifying underlying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
  • Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex data observations in simple terms, ensuring clarity and understanding among stakeholders. Master the art of storytelling with data, driving organizational change and strategy through powerful presentations and reports.
  • Entrepreneurial Approach: A proactive problem-solver, focused on generating impactful results and identifying opportunities for improvement through data-driven insights.

Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Benefits

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:

  • Receive a competitive reward package ‚Äì reevaluated each year ‚Äì that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
  • Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
  • Make an impact on the environment and society with 2 (fully paid) Impact Days ‚Äì one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative
  • Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
  • Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! Most teams offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework
  • Invest in your development with an annual personal development budget to use on professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and more
  • Connect with your fellow Personios at regular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrations
  • Engage in a high-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes

About Us

Bring your best. Make your mark. We‚Äôre using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let‚Äôs build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.

Title: Data Analyst Trianee
Description:
As a part of the Digital Capabilities team in the Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyse, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes.
Develop and maintain data products.
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting.
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards.
Lead automation of processes and analyses.
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS.
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting.
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines.


Basic Qualifications


Interest in an analytical or business intelligence role.
Experience with data visualization and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in MS Office suite.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Intermediate DAX skills, or willingness to learn.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards.
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives.
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment.
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis.
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS.
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise.
Microsoft PowerBI experience.
Project management experience.
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus.
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,‚ÄØcitizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic‚ÄØinformation, marital status, age, or disability.


Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about data and love uncovering meaningful insights? Futurae, a leading Swiss cybersecurity company, is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic and agile team. As a Senior Data Analyst at Futurae, you will play a critical role in designing, building, and improving our internal and customer-facing dashboards and tools for data analysis. Your work will contribute to providing valuable business insights to both internal stakeholders and our customers. Join us and be part of shaping the future of cybersecurity while creating outstanding user experiences!

About Us

Futurae is a customer-centric cybersecurity company that focuses on providing seamless authentication and transaction confirmation solutions. Our innovative approach prioritizes security and usability, empowering businesses to combat online threats effectively. With our experienced and diverse team of industry leaders, we constantly strive to solve the toughest challenges in online authentication and transaction signing. Join our young, international, and fast-paced team and play a significant role in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Learn more about us at www.futurae.com.

What You'll Do


Design, build, and optimize internal and customer-facing dashboards and tools for data analysis
Analyze data to uncover meaningful insights and provide actionable recommendations to stakeholders
Collaborate closely with product management and technical architects to define feature specifications
Partner with product, research/design and marketing teams to define A/B testing hypotheses, success metrics, and ensure statistically sound test design
Analyze and interpret results to inform product roadmap and marketing optimization
Participate in the development cycle of our software product and follow Agile development practices
Write high-quality, maintainable code in languages such as Python, R, or SQL



Requirements


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, preferably in a cybersecurity or technology-related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a passion for uncovering insights from complex datasets
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as Metabase or Tableau
Experience with statistical analysis techniques and familiarity with machine learning concepts
Solid programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or SQL
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex information
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Understanding of data security measures and privacy regulations in relevant industries


If you are a self-driven and detail-oriented individual who loves working with data and enjoys finding insights that drive business decisions, we would love to hear from you. Join Futurae and contribute to making a significant impact on the future of cybersecurity!

Benefits

Why Futurae

Join a young, international, and fast-paced Cybersecurity company with experienced industry leaders


Futurae Stock Options
Yearly personal learning & development budget
Apple Laptop and equipment for work purposes
Ability to work remotely (European time zones only)
Work at the forefront of an inspiring, dynamic tech company in the B2B space in the area of end-user authentication and transaction confirmation
Be part of our friendly, knowledge-sharing, entrepreneurial culture and flat hierarchy, where we value open and respectful communication, collaboration and an attitude that gets things done for our customers
Work in a role that gives you responsibility and independence
Access to coaching, ongoing professional development and training, mentorship and our culture of continuous learning


Futurae is an Equal Opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

By sending your application, you allow Futurae to handle and store your data.
Show more

Title: Junior Compliance Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Reinventing since 1939. We are one of the leading Print and Personal Systems technology companies in the world and our vision is to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere. Joining HP is joining an adventure to reinvent the tech world and reinvent yourself every day!

Job Summary

We are seeking an enthusiastic and detail-oriented individual to join our Take Back Compliance team as a Data Analyst. The team is responsible for ensuring the implementation of Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) Compliance. This entry-level position focuses on project management and report automation tasks. The ideal candidate will have a foundational understanding of data management principles and a willingness to learn and grow within the role.

This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on complex projects and develop your skills in data management and report automation. If you are passionate about data and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply.

Responsibilities

Data Mining:


Utilize modern tools and programming languages to mine data and extract valuable information.
Develop and maintain code to extract, transform, and load data from various document formats into SQL databases.


Project Support


Assist in managing projects using Agile methodology.
Coordinate project activities and ensure timely delivery of tasks.
Review and evaluate project designs to ensure compliance with standards.


Report Automation


Develop automated reporting processes to provide timely and accurate information to stakeholders.
Design, develop, and manage interactive BI reports and dashboards in Power BI.
Provide end-user training and support on Power BI tools and features.


Data Management


Support database management tasks, ensuring data quality, security, and accessibility.
Design database schemas and implementing ETL processes.
Maintain and update documentation related to database management.


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, or equivalent, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Work experience is not required, but appropriate internships related to the job content would be a plus.


Knowledge & Skills


Database Management: Understanding of SQL database management and ETL processes.
Programming: Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Power BI: Basic knowledge of Power BI and data visualization.
Communication: Excellent communication skills in English.


Other Knowledge To Be Value


Experience writing VBA Excel Macros.
Familiarity with EPR compliance, the WEEE directive, and ESG reporting.
Familiarity with AI frameworks and tools such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.
Basic understanding of Agile methodology.


What We Offer


Opportunity to work in an international organization with colleagues coming from all over the world.
Diverse, continued internal growth and career opportunities. Including HP‚Äôs own learning platform and LinkedIn Learning.
An attractive benefits package:
Health & Life insurance
Lunch at reduced prices at our canteen/ ticket restaurant vouchers
HP product discount
Work life balance / flexible working hours.
Women, Pride, Young employees, Sustainability and DisAbility! Just a few of our fantastic global business networks you can get involved with locally.
We also dedicate time and resources to contribute with our community through Corporate Volunteering activities, including our onsite HP Charity day.
Do you like to give back to the community? Then join one of our many volunteering teams or be a part of the incredible HP charity day held on site annually.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor) with 25+ regular coordinated‚ÄØactivities.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy, and general health.
Printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on‚ÄØworkshops‚ÄØto print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models.
Dedicated lactation room.
Our Women Network organizes activities such as Networking, the promotion of STEM vocations, talks on, improving business acumen, work life balance and skills of the future, etc.

Sounds like you? Apply and let‚Äôs have a talk!

Description:

As a Global Talent Data Analyst, your mission is to leverage advanced data analytics techniques and tools to extract actionable insights and enhance decision-making throughout our organization. You will collaborate closely with key stakeholders, applying statistical modeling and data visualization skills to ensure data quality and enable informed decisions within the Talent & Rewards (Talent Acquisition, Capacity & Workforce Planning, Talent Management, Learning & Development and Rewards) function.

Your Responsibilities

HR & Talent & Learning (T&L) Data Analytics:


Gather and transform organizational raw data into actionable insights.
Design, deploy and sustain dashboards, metrics, and reports to inform business decisions.


Functional Expertise


Understand Talent related processes.
Provide expertise in People Analytics methodologies.


Stakeholder Management


Collaborate with HR Center Of Expertise Leaders / T&L HUB Leaders and Reporting Experts.
Support Business Units' analytics needs through Capability & Workforce Planning SPOCs.
Translate data findings into meaningful recommendations.


Technical Proficiency


Excel: Proficient in data manipulation, formulas, and visualization.
Power BI: Develop interactive dashboards and visualizations.
Power Query: Extract, transform, and load data efficiently.
SQL (nice to have): Query databases for advanced analysis.


Data Quality Focus


Ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability of Talent data.
Implement Data Governance Practices.


Proactive And Innovative Approach


Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.
Propose innovative solutions to enhance Talent related processes.


Your Background


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in HR, Business, Data Science, Engineering, or related field.
Proven experience in People Analytics or HR Data Analysis.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
Curiosity and a proactive mindset.
Excellent Skills in Excel, Power BI and Power Query.
Excellent Skills in MS Office.
Fluent English.
SQL proficiency (nice to have).
Machine Learning (nice to have).
Familiarity with Talent, Learning and Rewards Functions.
Knowledge of statistical analysis and predictive modeling.


Apply now

Remote - Barcelona, Spain;

Remote - Lisbon, Portugal Job type Full time Experience Experienced Job function Data Analytics | Warehousing & Business Intelligence Contract Regular Publication date 2024-06-28 Reference number R0054646

¬øQui√©nes somos?

Para Sodexo, crecimiento y compromiso social van de la mano. Nuestro prop√≥sito es mejorar el d√≠a a d√≠a de las personas para crear una vida mejor para todos.

SPOC de Espa√±a en el grupo para todos los proyectos del programa de DATA y Reporting.

An√°lisis de soluciones: Estrecha colaboraci√≥n con los equipos de IT, RRHH y dem√°s unidades de negocio, para comprender sus necesidades a nivel de reporting y funcionalidades de recursos humanos y proporcionar soluciones tecnol√≥gicas que respalden sus objetivos.

Formaci√≥n: Grado en Inform√°tica/Ingenier√≠a/Telecomunicaciones..
Experiencia de 3 a 5 a√±os de experiencia trabajando con datos de RRHH.

Experiencia en programaci√≥n y tratamiento de datos relacionales. Lenguaje SQL.
Valorable conocimientos en Soluciones CEGID: People Net, Meta4 eMind, Meta4 T.Innova, Visual Time, otros.

Atenci√≥n al detalle. Pensamiento anal√≠tico. Capaz de gestionar m√∫ltiples flujos de trabajo y prioridades, asegurando la entrega.

Ingles Nivel Alto

Title: Checkout Data Analyst (Hybrid)
Description:
Checkout Data Analyst (They/She/He) - (Hybrid)

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking an experienced Checkout Data Analyst to join our Checkout team in Barcelona (hybrid), which is passionate about data, automation, analysis and innovation and loves to work in a collaborative and agile environment. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

20 million customers ‚Äì 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 5.4M members in Prime

16.2 million bookings FY23 - More than 50,000 bookings per day - 100 million daily user searches

1400 employees ‚Äì More than 50 different nationalities - 99% permanent contracts - 36.3 average age

We're a leading travel tech company, revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Checkout Data Analyst in the Checkout team you will be in charge of:


Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and taking ownership of the different data sources from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights
Own team metrics identifying the drivers of over and underperformance and providing data driven recommendations for how we can improve the KPIs performance
Turn business questions into functional analysis, extract relevant and actionable insights working with data from many different data sources using SQL/BQ and work with your stakeholders to make them happen
Elaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions
Design and execute measurement experiments; Analyse performance and user behaviours in the A/B Tests experiments or Pre-Post run by the business stakeholders
Create dashboards and tracking: ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs, as well as, foster data-driven decision making across the organisation. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage relevant data
Contribute to the delivery of strategic projects: participate in the delivery of key initiatives, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with stakeholders in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side



What you need to succeed:

Job Requirements

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Experience in a role with strong analytical component
Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; python/R programming skills and experience with Looker Studio, Power BI will be valued
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with Microsoft and Google Office package (Excel, etc.)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with high attention to detail
Strong organisational and communication skills
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys having fun!
Business Proficiency in English



What‚Äôs in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

I f you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

  • Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
  • Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
  • Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.


Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

I f you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Power BI
Description:
At SD Worx, we are focused on building capability and flexibility to meet the growth of the business whilst increasing the profitability across the organisation. We support SD Worx on most of the business areas such as HR, Finance, Marketing, Software Development, Testing, Implementation and Service Delivery. There are numerous opportunities at SD Worx for people with the right blend of skills, experience and character! Are you ready to join us?

¬†

Your team

The Corporate Data Intelligence team, part of the Corporate Information Office, is providing reports, dashboards & analytics for the entire SD Worx Group. The team takes care of the data warehouse architecture, the ETL-processes, data mappings & definitions, and the transformation of Corporate Data into Information & Insights. The ultimate goal is to reinforce Business Excellence in all domains and at all levels in the organization.


What does your day look like?


In this role, you specifically focus on first line support for data & insight needs of our Sales/Business.
You also analyze how we can improve our Corporate Data Solutions and to unlock new opportunities to increase our efficiency and/or impact on the organization.
Together with your colleagues, you set-up new or improve existing data solutions.
You present and promote solutions to the internal stakeholders
You contribute within & between teams, by sharing your knowledge and best practices.
Depending on personal interest, you also have to opportunity
- to explore statistical data analytics
- to work on other Information Office projects within other domains (eg. Finance, Sales, Operations, HR, Marketing‚Ä¶)



Your profile


You have strong communication and you are able to act as a Partner for our internal Businesses.
You have a strong interest in data, reporting and analytics.
You have expertise in the reporting tool Power Bi (approximately 5 years).
You are a team player with flexibility to engage both in small individual assignments as in large team assignments.
You are eager to learn and have a result-driven mind-set



Experience considered as a plus:


Knowledge of Salesforce
Experience with Sales and/or Marketing
Experience with CX
Experience with Finance or HR
Experience in Payroll & HR Domain
Experience in agile methodology
Knowledge of Reporting Tools such as Tableau, IBM Cognos.
Knowledge of SAP4H and/or SuccessFactors
Knowledge of statistics

¬†

From many places, we work as one, moving from better to best together.

SD Worx lives diversity in the workplace. Diversity provides inspiration and innovation in our company. We particularly welcome applications from qualified talent, regardless of origin, nationality, gender, skin colour, ethnic and social background, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation and stage of life.

Title: Data Analyst (Growth)
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our sunny Barcelona office as a Data Analyst. You will be working together with other data analysts and data scientists focused on creating a holistic understanding of user journeys, life cycle management and user acquisition through online performance marketing and other media. As a Data Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets. Thus, covering the full scope from data mining to reporting. In addition you will also be responsible to evangelize the usage of data via dashboards and/or other means of visualizations to key stakeholders throughout the company.

What You'll Do

Why this role?

This role is intended to strengthen the existing growth team in Product Madness and to ensure we are using the right data for the right decisions. Your key responsibilities will be to:
Work closely with other team members, data engineers and business stakeholders to ensure the data we are consuming is clean, robust and relevant.
Work closely with other team members to ensure they have easy access to reliable and relevant data in their work optimizing channels and campaigns by delivering self-service data though dashboards.
Perform on-demand quantitative analysis and reports to inform growth and/or operational strategy.
Execute and evangelize actionable insights within the team to optimise growth marketing.
Proactively work with our partners such as Apple, Google, Appsflyer etc. to ensure we maintain our ability to derive insights from the data we are provided with.
To do this successfully we believe you are:
Passionate about quantitative analysis and will have the ability to generate actionable business insights for the growth team, game teams and Product Madness as a whole.
Intuitive with regards to data interpretation, e.g. spotting anomalies without giving it a second thought.
Having a good understanding of core statistical concepts and techniques.


Requirements

What We're Looking For
2+ years work experience as a data analyst or data scientist in a similar field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Preferred experience with ETL and data engineering processes
Fluent in English


Meriting Skills
A masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or a similar discipline
Experience with Python and/or R
Experience with building and tweaking attribution models
Experience with regression modelling and statistical analysis
Experience with setting up and analyzing A/B-tests
Experience from working with other F2P games, social casino titles or RMG or general knowledge about the mobile games industry or similarly sophisticated customer-facing digital businesses.
Interested in gaming and the mobile game industry


Why Product Madness?

You will be joining a global powerhouse where you will be part of a world-class talented team that creates remarkable hit games such as Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino, Mighty Fu, and Big Fish Casino. The success of these titles has led to over 400 million downloads and more than 50 million active users. But there is no stopping us there, we also have a new games team that is working on bringing new hit games to the market. Product Madness is an Aristocrat Technologies company within its digital games division of Pixel United.

Outstanding growth has seen us build Product Madness to more than 800 team members and counting, you can join one of our seven global talent hubs including London, USA, Canada, Spain, Poland, Ukraine & Israel.

You will be part of a company that is not only Mad about games but Mad about our people. Living by our value of people first, you will feel this firsthand from the moment you step into one of our fantastic studios. This is made possible by our amazing studio experience team who help make Product Madness such a fun place to work. Be it arranging endless snacks, weekly breakfasts & lunches, lavish Christmas & summer parties, happy hour drinks, social get-togethers and so much more.

So what is stopping you from coming and joining the Madness?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world‚Äôs best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None
Show more

Title: Junior Business Insights and Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Business Environment

The Customer Support & Services Delivery (CSSD) Business Insights and Analytics is team within Digital and Transformation Organization focused on supporting CSSD Businesses with data, reports and insights to improve Customer experience and drive operational excellence through the right set of actionable metrics to accelerate innovation and transformation, in this case is specifically supporting Customer Care Center Organization.

Job Summary

This role is responsible for collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data to support decision-making and provide insights to the organization. The role works with large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations, helping businesses make informed choices and optimize their operations. The role utilizes various tools, techniques, and analytical skills to extract meaningful information from data and communicate their findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Responsibilities


Understanding business requirements, creating reports, analytics and business intelligence
Works with global reporting teams to set up and adapt standard reporting, based on business requirements.
Works together with Customer Care Center teams/internal customers to capture and met business requirements
Create reports and business intelligence to better understand operational performance of our Contact Centers
Provides insight on call drivers and customer satisfaction drivers
Analyze ways to avoid calls by providing solutions on the web
Identifies anomalies in data to enable issue prevention
Optimization and standardization
Identify improvement opportunities


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Work experience is not required, but appropriate internships related to the job content would be a plus.


Preferred Certifications


Programming Language/s Certification (SQL, Python, or similar)


Knowledge And Skills


Data Analysis, Data Management, Data Modeling, Data Quality, Data Science, Data Visualization and Data Warehousing
Using data collection and analysis tools and software packages to gather, integrate and analyze data from multiple sources.
Strong analytical, statistical and problem solving skills.
Understanding of industry quality standards and methodologies.
Using empirical and root- cause analysis, modeling, and testing methodologies to identify areas for process improvement.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English.
Ability to effectively communicate plans, proposals, and results, and negotiate options at different levels.


What We Offer


Opportunity to work in an international organization with colleagues coming from all over the world.
Diverse, continued internal growth and career opportunities. Including HP‚Äôs own learning platform and LinkedIn Learning.
An attractive benefits package:
Health & Life insurance
Lunch at reduced prices at our canteen/ ticket restaurant vouchers
HP product discount
Work life balance / flexible working hours.
Women, Pride, Young employees, Sustainability and DisAbility! Just a few of our fantastic global business networks you can get involved with locally.
We also dedicate time and resources to contribute with our community through Corporate Volunteering activities, including our onsite HP Charity day.
Do you like to give back to the community? Then join one of our many volunteering teams or be a part of the incredible HP charity day held on site annually.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor) with 25+ regular coordinated‚ÄØactivities.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy, and general health.
Printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on‚ÄØworkshops‚ÄØto print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models.
Dedicated lactation room.
Our Women Network organizes activities such as Networking, the promotion of STEM vocations, talks on, improving business acumen, work life balance and skills of the future, etc.

Sounds like you? Apply and let‚Äôs have a talk!

Title: Climate Data Analyst
Description:
Climate Data Specialist, Zurich Resilience Solutions, 80%-100%

At Zurich Resilience Solutions (ZRS) we‚Äôre committed to supporting our customers and business partners through harnessing the expertise in our global network.

We have a brand new role to help shape and grow our business which is going from strength to strength.

Your role in our Climate Resilience team is to support in the development, and deployment of state-of-the-art risk assessment methods and tools. In this role you will be working closely with customer facing business units as well as internal technical functions within Zurich Insurance (e.g. Group Accumulation Management, Group Re, Commercial Insurance Underwriting) towards sourcing and developing climate data and tools for our customers. Your core responsibility in this role is to source, analyze, and visualize data sets (hazard, exposures, controls) to support in the assessment of natural hazards and climate change risks.

What You Will Do

As a Climate Data Specialist your main responsibilities will involve:

Technical Developments


Support the development and continuous update of climate and natural hazards data
Monitor global sustainability regulations and frameworks to identify needs in terms of climate data and develop these.
Support in the development of data processing and visualization tools


Customer Projects


Source and analyse data from internal and open-source databases.
Transform natural hazard and climate change exposure data into key messages and insights/conclusions to help customers build climate change resilience.


Communication


Creation, maintenance and internal sharing of natural hazard and climate change training and knowledge content
Facilitate climate data knowledge sharing across the CCRS community, as well as other internal stakeholders and customers


What You Bring

As Climate Data Specialist your skills and qualifications will ideally include:


Master‚Äôs degree in natural/environmental/atmospheric sciences.
Deep understanding of Climate Change and Natural Hazards science, models, and their practical implementation.
Experience in spatial data management, climate data, spatial analysis, and visualization, big datasets, transforming data into insights for decision-making.
The ability to clearly communicate complicated concepts in a concise and compelling manner to all levels of management and stakeholders of various levels of technical proficiency.
High level of proficiency in data analytics and tools for visualization of spatial data and software, e.g. Power BI, ArcGIS, and programming languages (R, Python, etc.).
Fluent in written and spoken English at a technical level with strong customer service orientation. Any other language is an asset.


Additional Information

We look forward to receiving your online application.

Zurich wants to attract the best talent and we acknowledge that talents might not always be available full-time. At Zurich we will consider requests for flexible working. Many of our employees work flexibly in a variety of ways. Please talk to us during the interview about the flexibility you may need.

Information for recruitment agencies

Zurich does not accept any applications from recruitment agencies for this position. We refuse any responsibility for unsolicited applications as well as any associated fees.

Reuni√≥n con usuarios para la toma de requerimientos con el fin de transformarlos en KPI's significativos que ayuden a monitorear e impulsar el negocio.

Title: Data Analyst & Sales Coordinator
Description:
Job Number 24089816

Job Category Sales & Marketing

Location Hotel Arts Barcelona, Marina 19-21, Barcelona, Barcelona, Spain VIEW ON MAP

Schedule Full-Time

Located Remotely? N

Relocation? N

Position Type Non-Management

Position Summary

Enter, retrieve, reconcile, and verify information (e.g., commissions, leads, third parties) in software involved in the sales process. Monitor Sales team members' use of the Delphi tool to make sure it is used efficiently and effectively and that they comply with all related procedures. Inform Sales team members about compliance issues and updates related to the Delphi system (e.g., short cuts). Prepare reports of market research findings using Delphi, including graphic illustration and text description of findings. Prepare reports (e.g., production, business opportunity, period end, sales activity) as requested by Sales managers. Create, maintain and/or update databases, spreadsheets, and electronic filing systems related to Sales and Marketing activities (e.g., mailing lists, competition, tours). Perform general office duties to support Sales & Marketing (e.g., filing, sending emails, typing, sending outgoing faxes, delivering incoming faxes, copying, opening or distributing mail).

Follow all company policies and procedures; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Assist other employees to ensure proper coverage and prompt guest service. Speak with others using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Read and visually verify information in a variety of formats (e.g., small print). Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.

Preferred Qualifications

Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.

Related Work Experience: At least 1-year of related work experience.

Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.

License or Certification: None

Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.

At more than 100 award-winning properties worldwide, The Ritz-Carlton Ladies and Gentlemen create experiences so exceptional that long after a guest stays with us, the experience stays with them. Attracting the world‚Äôs top hospitality professionals who curate lifelong memories, we believe that everyone succeeds when they are empowered to be creative, thoughtful and compassionate.

Every day, we set the standard for rare and special luxury service the world over and pride ourselves on delivering excellence in the care and comfort of our guests.

Your role will be to ensure that the ‚ÄúGold Standards‚Äù of The Ritz-Carlton are delivered graciously and thoughtfully every day. The Gold Standards are the foundation of The Ritz-Carlton and are what guides us each day to be better than the next. It is this foundation and our belief that our culture drives success by which The Ritz Carlton has earned the reputation as a global brand leader in luxury hospitality. As part of our team, you will learn and exemplify the Gold Standards, such as our Employee Promise, Credo and our Service Values. And our promise to you is that we offer the chance to be proud of the work you do and who you work with.

In joining The Ritz-Carlton, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you.

Title: Data Visualization Analyst - Ads (They/She/He) (P803604)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.


We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!
We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!
We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).
We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.


üí™Our career development philosophy.


We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.
We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!
We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope.


ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good.


Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.
We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.
We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.


We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

As a Data Visualization Specialist for Glovo Ads, you will enhance Glovo‚Äôs advertising solutions for Partners and Brands by creating visualizations that demonstrate the effectiveness and value of advertising on our platform. You will enable data-driven decision-making by analyzing and visualizing data from our partners and brands to support their investment and growth. Your work will influence thousands of advertisers and hundreds of colleagues globally as part of the Ads Team at Glovo HQ. You will play a crucial role in delivering our Ads business plan, directly contributing to the company's performance worldwide.

THE JOURNEY

In This Pivotal Role, You Will


Craft high-impact visual narratives for both internal stakeholders and external clients across Restaurants and CPG Brands.
Translate complex data from our partners' advertising campaigns into clear, actionable insights.
Train and coach commercial teams to maximize the impact of data visualization solutions.
Serve as a bridge between our product, data and commercial teams, enhancing our product marketing efforts with compelling visual reports, insights, and informative dashboards.
Generate and utilize data on KPIs, ad campaign performance, and market trends to shape media plans, sales strategies, and reports.
Lead product marketing projects end-to-end to bring data insights to life.
Proactively identify opportunities to grow and optimize advertiser investments and ROAS through data analysis and forecasting.
See the big picture by connecting the dots and digging deep to uncover trends and insights from data, moving analyses beyond descriptive analytics.
Conduct audits and competitive analyses in the Retail media space to advocate why Glovo is the best platform for advertising.
Build data MVPs and collaborate with Data engineers to create new KPIs, prototyping new data visualization solutions, and drive the update of the existing reporting and analysis.
Develop, update, and manage the lifecycle of dashboards and reports, adhering to data governance guidelines.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Over 4 years of experience in advertising performance analysis, marketing science, or a related field focused on digital advertising sales.
Strong understanding of the digital advertising measurement ecosystem; attribution and incrementality concepts are your bread and butter.
Proficient in data analysis and report generation, with a keen ability to distill complex data into compelling stories.
Strong SQL skills, able to extract, manipulate, and analyze large sets of data with accuracy.
A passion for creating informative visualizations and presentations to communicate results to all levels of the company.
Excellent communication, visualization, and storytelling skills, applicable to both technical and business audiences.
An analytical mind, meticulous attention to detail, and a joy for solving problems.
Results-oriented and ready to make an impact on the organization.
Ability to understand our database layout and how data is related across different tables and data products.
Work as a collaborative, decisive partner and liaison across all parties, including clients, colleagues, and operations.
Ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously, meeting both near-term and long-term deadlines.


Nice to Have


A strong grasp of statistical concepts
Experience working with platform or high-tech companies, media agencies, advertising agencies, advertisers, or marketing research organizations is a plus.
Experience in Google Adwords, Meta Advertising, Amazon Ads, Trade Desk, Adsmovil, or ad tech platforms.
Proficiency in Looker is a huge plus.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
