Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì M/F - Oporto ‚Äì Open Ended Contract ‚Äì Hybrid
Description:
WHO ARE WE ?

BNP PARIBAS CARDIF, the Insurer for a Changing World.

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst (M/F) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC RSBI TEAM

As a Technical expert / administrator of Data Visualization et Data Preparation solution, you will have to ensure the functioning of existing Dashboards (based on DataViz solutions) et Data preparation tools, and develop new ones for Finance and Actuarial needs

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN RSBI TEAM


Create and maintain DataPrep wokflow / tools (Alteryx / Dataiku)
Modeling and development of dashboards within PowerBi and Tableau technologies
Write functional and/or technical documentation and create POCs (Proof Of Concept)
Ensure diagnostics and resolution of malfunctions
Participate to the implementation process improvements
Manipulate data to facilitate decisions by Finance teams


As Our New Accounting Analyst, You Must Have


Information systems background
Professional background about 2/3 years in a similar position
Knowledge of Application design and Data Visualization modeling
Data Preparation workflow modeling (Dataiku and Alteryx)
Databases / SQL language and Data Modeling (DMC)
Data Visualization / Restitution tools (mainly Tableau and Power BI)
Be fluent in English (B2/C1 level) and French (B2 level) ‚Äì mandatory


What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode ‚Äì a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
And much more‚Ä¶


The work environment is important!


Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.


Our commitments to you


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Data Governance Analyst (m/f)
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

In this project you‚Äôll contact with the European stock market area and will be able to work for a leading global trading platform that knows the importance of surveillance issues. Despite its development center being located in Porto and all administrative support in Lisbon, you will be part of a multicultural team that is spread across several European cities.

We are looking for a Data Governance Analyst to work in a project in Porto (hybrid model).

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in data management, data governance or related roles;
  • Experience of implementing, using, managing and promoting a Data Cataloguing solution (i.e.metadata tool);
  • Good understanding of data governance principles, frameworks and best practices;
  • Proficiency in SQL;
  • Excellent communication and people skills;
  • Problem-solving and critical thinking: ability to critically analyse issue and pro-actively develop effective options for recommendation;
  • Strong capacity of teamwork;
  • Fluency in English.

We Offer

  • Integration in a dynamic, experienced and friendly team;
  • Technical, behavioral and linguistics training opportunities;
  • Career development.

Do you think your profile fits this job description? Send us your CV to and come join the Dellent Team!

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for a Finance Data Analyst (M/F) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC FAR DATA TEAM

‚ÄúDonn√©es FAR‚Äù (stands for Finance, Actuary, and Risk Data) Department is in charge of providing data to 3 main departments of the company : Finance, Actuary and Risk. You responsibilities will be to collect, check, and provide data from our business to our internal clients (Finance, Actuary ‚Ä¶) using automated tools.

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN THE FAR DATA TEAM

  • Participate in data quality audit work on a defined scope:
  • Participate in the administration of the necessary repositories on its perimeter
  • Participate in the development of the reference documentation associated with the data
  • Participate in the governance of data quality

As Our New Finance Data Analyst, You Must Have

  • Degree in Data Analysis, Finance or Actuarial
  • Professional background about 3/5 years in data analysis for finance/accounting functions.
  • Fluent in English (C1 level is mandatory)
  • Fluency in French (B1-B2 level would be greatly appreciated)
  • Excel VBA
  • SAS
  • Python
  • Datavizualisation Tools (PowerBi, Qlik‚Ä¶)

What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :

  • Meals allowance
  • Transportation allowance
  • Child allowance
  • Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
  • Hybrid working mode ‚Äì a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
  • Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
  • And much more‚Ä¶

The work environment is important!

  • Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
  • Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
  • Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.

Our commitments to you

  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Data & AI Security Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a skilled and passionate Data & AI Security Professional to join our team. As a Data & AI Security Professional, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing innovative Data & AI-driven solutions to address complex business challenges. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to collect, analyze, and interpret data to drive actionable insights and enhance decision-making processes.

Key Responsibilities



You provide technical leadership as we design and deploy secure Data&AI architectures for on premises and cloud solutions.


Leading workshops on the key Data & AI security challenges of our clients.


Experience in preparing system security reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends for project and operational and project governance reporting.


Strong analytical skills to solve technical issues and flexibility in handling multiple issues at once.


Partnering with our clients to find the best Data & AI security solutions.


Driven cyber security professional with a passion for information security.



Qualifications



A Bachelor‚Äôs degree, preferably related to Business IT or Security, such as Business Informatics, Computer Security, Data Science or equivalent.


Basic understanding of Cybersecurity and at least one of the fundamental areas of Data Security: Discovery and Classification or Data Encryption.


Knowledge in programming languages such as Python, R, Scala or related.


Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and statistics.


Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills in addition to strong attention to detail.


Strong collaboration skills, ideally working with global and multi-functional teams.


Fluent in English.


Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

Title: Data Engineer (Hybrid @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: 6+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer;
Expertise on end-to-end Data Pipeline Development, ETL processes and Alteryx;
Knowledge in Data Mesh concepts (Starburst, Trino);
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala;
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases;
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Databricks, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Kafka;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

French AND/OR Portuguese fluency.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?




Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


  • DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
  • DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
  • DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.



At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Engineer to join us in Porto.


Responsabilities:

  • To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.
  • As a Data Specialist, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving;
  • You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic;
  • You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis;
  • You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges.


Requirements:

  • Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields;
  • Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI;
  • Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
  • Proficiency in SQL;
  • Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus;
  • Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus;
  • Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English to career@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúGD / DE‚Äù



Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analytics Engineer
Description:
For our Digital Team we are looking for a Data Analytics Engineer




To strengthen our team, we are looking for a Data Analytics Engineer, with a passion for water & digitalization




Skills and Qualifications:

The most fundamental skills for this position are:

Prior experience in Python programming
Experience with agile development and DevOps principles
Familiar in data analysis, business intelligence, dashboarding and reporting
Experience with relational databases, process historians and data lakes
Fluent in English




In addition to these, we are looking for someone with the following skills and qualifications:

You have a scientific background that indicates your capacity to develop narratives rooted in data
You are interested in Microsoft Azure Cloud
You have prior experience in process automation, Ignition Perspective
You are familiar with basic UI/UX concepts and tools




Soft skills:

intrinsically motivated to work for an environmental engineering company
know how to articulate your ideas and solutions well
proactively improving existing systems / looking for improvements
independent
enjoy working with others
customer-oriented




If you don't meet all the requirements, but you are eager to learn and have a passion for digitalization and water, don't hesitate to apply. We are looking for someone who is willing to learn and grow with us.




Responsibilities

Co-develop our operational intelligence platform SmartLab (Dashboarding, reporting, exploratory data analysis & e.g. treatment performance, energy consumption, chemical usage, etc.)
Bridge between data engineers and operational engineers
Analyse what the needs are and translating these into a functional solutions
Maintain and improve existing data analytics solutions
Present your work on a regular basis to internal and external stakeholders
Train internal and external users and developers




What we offer

A challenging job in a international company with a strong focus on sustainability and innovation.
Working in a team where your input is valued and where you can make a difference.
Pushing the boundaries of what is possible in the world of water and wastewater treatment. As Data analytics engineer, you will have tangible impact on your environment.
A competitive salary package with extra-legal benefits.




Your Team

Waterleau Digital Solutions (WDS) is an entity responsible for building, implementing and guarding the Waterleau digital strategic vision. WDS develop digital products and solutions for internal clients (e.g. Engineering, Services) and external clients (e.g. our SmartLab platform), according to the defined and identified needs, in line with the global Waterleau strategy.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Meritis is an IT consulting, management and development firm founded in 2007, with offices in Paris, Sophia-Antipolis, Aix-en-Provence, Montpellier, Toulouse, Nantes, Lille, ... And now Lisbon! Our mission? To connect the best talents with companies, and give them a head start.




We support our customers in all their digital transformation needs through a wide range of areas of expertise: Software Engineering, Finance, Project Management, Devops, Data, Cloud, Cybersecurity and Agility.




We are active in the banking, insurance, telecommunications, industry and transport sectors, and today 40% of CAC40 companies are Meritis customers.




Backed by our values of high standards, humility, benevolence and proximity, we now employ over 900 people.




We make it a point of honor to be close to our employees and to provide them with individualized support, whatever their position within the company.




Certified Great Place To Work since 2013, our concept of well-being at work goes far beyond a simple label, and it's our employees who speak best of it: https://www.glassdoor.fr/Avis/Meritis-Avis-E1163008.htm.







Job Description:

Within the Pricing & Analytics, you will join the Calculation Engines team as a Java Scala Developer. The Pricing & Analytics department is in charge of developing and maintaining the Equity (TK EDA) and Fixed Income (ARM) financial libraries, and integrating them into various IS applications. These libraries manage derivatives on the Equity, Commodity and Fixed Income markets.

The Calculation Engines teams use these pricing libraries to set up robust, industrialized calculation workflows for Global Market's Front Office and Risk functions. These calculation chains process large volumes of data, while complying with calculation time and storage constraints for audit trails. They must also expose custom APIs for data access.







Requirements:

Consultant specializing in Information Systems with a solid knowledge of market finance, comfortable with Agile methodologies. The following technical skills are expected.




Programming languages: Java, Scala, Python

Development environment: Visual Studio, GIT, Jenkins

BigData solutions: Hadoop platform, Spark programming,

Other: REST API, microservices, Axway, NoSQL & SQL databases, Grid Computing (DataSynapse) & caching.

Knowledge of Summit software development is a plus.

Fluent English (written and spoken).







Additional information:




Are you ready to take on new challenges within an environment conducive to well-being?




Being a consultant at Meritis means:

Evolving in a company where learning is encouraged: certification training, e-learning, meetUp, code competitions, career paths, etc;
Being part of communities of experts who share their knowledge and experience;
Choice of project;
Benefit from a network of clients who trust us and whom we have built up over the years;
Work in a friendly environment with a lot of events: lunches, afterworks, teambuilding, annual parties, etc;
Join a company where it's good to work, certified "Great Place to Work".




Our differences are our assets. That's why Meritis is committed to diversity and non-discrimination. All our jobs are accessible to people with disabilities.




We look forward to hearing from you. You can contact ethiquegroup@meritis.fr if you believe you are a victim or witness of discrimination.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.


DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:


  • DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;


  • DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;


  • DECSKILL CONNECT through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.


Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.


We are looking for a Data Engineer:


Responsibilities:

  • To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.
  • As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving;
  • You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic;
  • You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis;
  • You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges.


Requirements:

  • Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields;
  • Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI;
  • Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
  • Proficiency in SQL;
  • Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus;
  • Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus; and
  • Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.
  • Fluency in English (both written and spoken) is mandatory.


If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/DataEngineer‚Äù


Thank You! üòä


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About the company:

Avenue Code is the leading software consultancy focused on delivering end-to-end development solutions for digital transformation across every vertical. We‚Äôre privately held, profitable, and have been on a solid growth trajectory since day one. We care deeply about our clients, our partners, and our people. We prefer the word ‚Äòpartner‚Äô over ‚Äòvendor‚Äô, and our investment in professional relationships is a reflection of that philosophy. We pride ourselves on our technical acumen, our collaborative problem-solving ability, and the warm professionalism of our teams.

Avenue Code has been believing in and promoting plurality actions for over 10 years, understanding that recognizing differences and fostering a safe environment, employment opportunities, representation, and support are the best ways to promote an increasingly equitable culture.

About the opportunity:

We are seeking an experienced data professional specialising in data visualization to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for transforming complex data into valuable insights that support strategic decisions within the company.

This is a hybrid role in Porto.

Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain efficient and scalable data pipelines using Snowflake and Databricks.
Create and optimize data models supporting reports and dashboards in Power BI.
Collaborate with business teams to understand data requirements and create solutions that meet their needs.
Implement robust and efficient ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
Ensure data integrity and quality, monitoring and resolving performance issues.
Develop and maintain technical documentation and user guides.


Required Qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field.
Solid experience with data, focusing on data visualization.
Proficiency in Snowflake and Databricks.
Experience with Power BI and other data visualization tools.
Knowledge of SQL and Python or other relevant programming languages.
Ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proficient level in Portuguese and communicative English.


Nice to Have:

English proficiency is an advantage.

Avenue Code reinforces its commitment to privacy and to all the principles guaranteed by the most accurate global data protection laws, such as GDPR, LGPD, CCPA and CPRA. The Candidate data shared with Avenue Code will be kept confidential and will not be transmitted to disinterested third parties, nor will it be used for purposes other than the application for open positions. As a Consultancy company, Avenue Code may share your information with its clients and other Companies from the CompassUol Group to which Avenue Code‚Äôs consultants are allocated to perform its services.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English and Portuguese speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.





This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task




.

alBeing open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevanc
e)Applicants must be 18 years or ove




r.

Title: Data Engineer (Scala)
Description:
Transformation, adaptability and innovation are part of our DNA.

We are passionate about technology and we want to be part of your story!

Do you want to make your career goals in IT real?

Do we share the same passion?

You have come to the right place, Smart!




What does it take to become a SMART Data Engineer (Scala) ?

The data engineer will participate in the development of various modules developed in Spark with Scala, in Hive, in HBase, in Indexima, and with interactions with Rest API and external databases such as SQLServer and Oracle. They will work in SCRUM in a team whose members are based between Portugal and France.

The data engineer will be involved in the technical design of the modules, their implementation and the automation of tests, and will also have to interact with operations to implement the modules.




Required qualifications :

Experience with Big Data and NoSQL Technology (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, SolR, HBase, Kerberos)
Experienced with functional programming (Scala, SBT)
English B2+




Nice to have:

Experience in an Agile environment (SCRUM)
Knowledge of ZIO, MONIX, CATS libraries is valued (functional programming)
Knowledge of Kafka and Schema Registry
Knowledge of Rest API




Why be SMART?

We make the projects we take part in real

We love what we do and take pride in the results of our work

We are simple and efficient We value our people

We are a dynamic team with integrity and trust




Join us and apply for this opportunity!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: mid level

Type of position: hybrid

The amazing you, will have:




3+years experience working with data;
Proficiency in SQL (Crud, data models, transactionality, tuning);
Knowledge about multidimensional modeling concepts;
Strong data analysis skills;
TDD\BDD knowledge;
Knowledge of Continuous Delivery/Continuous Integration, Delivery, and Deployment through CI Pipelines;
Good English level.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Good French level




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!

Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English and Portuguese speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.





This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task




.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Chegou o momento de te desafiares a sair da tua zona de conforto fazendo parte de um grande projeto? Vem trabalhar connosco e potenciar ainda mais o teu desenvolvimento!

Integra uma equipa onde trabalhar√°s com os melhores especialistas em Data. Enquanto Engineer, ter√°s a oportunidade de levar os nossos projetos de transforma√ß√£o ao pr√≥ximo n√≠vel, √† escala global, criando e entregando solu√ß√µes inovadoras de Portugal para o mundo. Procuramos perfis que combinem skills de abstra√ß√£o e alguns conhecimentos t√©cnicos da plataforma, com o mindset orientado para a excel√™ncia do nosso servi√ßo ao cliente.

Na Deloitte nunca trabalhar√°s sozinho e, por isso, oferecemos um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira com forma√ß√£o ajustada ao teu perfil e aos teus objetivos profissionais. Ter√°s uma experi√™ncia profissional que te ir√° inspirar, ao lado de outros talentos como tu, a transformar o mundo como o conhecemos: a torn√°-lo mais humano, eficiente e tecnol√≥gico. Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos √† procura dos melhores especialistas em tecnologia para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excel√™ncia e √† nossa comunidade, para desenvolverem solu√ß√µes √∫nicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transforma√ß√£o.

Est√£o reunidos todos os ingredientes para poderes embarcar nesta viagem enriquecedora e desafiante que √© o mundo Deloitte?

O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades v√£o ser compostos por:

  • Analise de dados em v√°rias tecnologias, SQL e No-SQL;
  • Desenho, implementa√ß√£o, e monitoriza√ß√£o de pipelines ETL;
  • Cria√ß√£o de processos para tratamento de dados (data profiling, cleansing, masking);
  • Desenho e implementa√ß√£o de solu√ß√µes real-time analytics;
  • Desenho e implementa√ß√£o de solu√ß√µes Big Data;
  • Desenho e Implementa√ß√£o de solu√ß√µes data-driven distribu√≠das com recurso a tecnologias Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP);
  • Colaborar com v√°rios stakeholders na defini√ß√£o, tratamento de dados e implementa√ß√£o de modelos avan√ßados de Machine Learning.
  • Garantir a coordena√ß√£o entre equipas t√©cnicas e funcionais no √¢mbito de projetos de dados;


√âs tu quem procuramos:

  • Forma√ß√£o superior nas √°reas de Engenharia ou similares;
  • Conhecimento da l√≠ngua Inglesa (oral e escrita) e disponibilidade para viajar; Entre 2 a 6 Anos de experi√™ncia profissional em projetos de Data;
  • Conhecimento de processos de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Experi√™ncia com metodologias Agile;
  • Conhecimentos de linguagens SQL / No SQL;
  • Conhecimentos em Python;
  • Experi√™ncia profissional em solu√ß√µes ETL (exemplos, Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, Snowflake, SSIS, IBM DataStage) (preferencial);
  • Experi√™ncia em solu√ß√µes da Data Visualization (exemplos, Power BI, Tableau);
  • Experi√™ncia profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes;
  • Conhecimento das solu√ß√µes Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribu√≠dos;
  • Experi√™ncia profissional em solu√ß√µes/tecnologias Big Data (exemplos, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, ELK, MongoDB) (preferencial);
  • Orienta√ß√£o para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Comunica√ß√£o, trabalho em equipa, resolu√ß√£o de problemas e capacidade anal√≠tica.


Desenvolve uma carreira √† tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem cont√≠nuos
  • Atrav√©s de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades t√©cnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, √†s tuas necessidades e objetivos
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimens√£o e impacto relevante nesta √°rea de especializa√ß√£o
  • Acesso ilimitado √†s maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy
  • Oportunidade de forma√ß√µes e certifica√ß√µes nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud


Vive uma cultura de uni√£o

  • Uma cultura de inova√ß√£o e excel√™ncia que nos torna l√≠deres e precursores de tend√™ncias
  • Um ambiente amig√°vel, de respeito, confian√ßa, transpar√™ncia e informalidade
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de l√≠deres e especialistas
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte, nunca trabalhar√°s sozinho. Title: Data Engineer
Description:
# Think Data Be Smart #




About Us: DataSmart is a Portuguese company, positioning itself as a consulting company of excellence, with over 20 years of existence. We are specialized in Technologies and Information Systems services for the Portuguese and International markets. We pride ourselves on fostering a culture of involvement, experience, and excellence.




Join our team as a Data Engineer (Hybrid - Porto and Lisbon)!




What You'll Do:

Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes.
Work with Google BigQuery, Snowflake, and Databricks to manage and analyze large datasets.
Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and transformation.
Use Python for data manipulation, automation, and complex data processing tasks.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
Utilize Power BI to create interactive and insightful data visualizations and reports.
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation procedures.
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, ensuring high performance and reliability of data systems.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to continuously improve data engineering practices.




Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
5+years of experience as a Data Engineer.
Extensive experience with Google BigQuery, Snowflake, and Databricks.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong Python programming skills for data processing and automation.
Experience with Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Knowledge of ETL processes and tools.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment and communicate with cross-functional teams.
Fluent in Portuguese and English, both oral and written.




At DataSmart, you will have the opportunity to integrate into a solid company and participate in projects of high recognition, nationally and internationally, with an appealing technological environment and career progression.




Excellence in the way to the future!




Connect with Us: Follow us on LinkedIn for updates on career opportunities, company news, and industry insights! For further details, visit us at www.datasmart.pt




#JoinOurTeam #DataSmart #ThinkDataBeSmart #DataEngineer #BigQuery #Snowflake #Databricks #SQL #Python #PowerBI #ETL #Portugal

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
FARFETCH exists for the love of fashion. Our mission is to be the global platform for luxury fashion, connecting creators, curators and consumers.

We're a positive platform for good, bringing together an incredible creative community made up by our people, our partners and our customers. This community is at the heart of our business success. We welcome differences, empower individuality and celebrate diverse skills and perspectives, creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We are FARFETCH for All.




TECHNOLOGY

We're on a mission to build the technology that powers the global platform for luxury fashion. We operate a modular end-to-end technology platform purpose-built to connect the luxury fashion ecosystem worldwide, addressing complex challenges and enjoying it. We're empowered to break traditions and revolutionise, with the freedom and autonomy to make a difference for our customers all over the world.




PORTO

Our Porto office is located in Portugal's vibrant second city, known for its history and its creative yet cosy environment. From Account Management to Technology and Product, whatever your skills are, you'll find your fit here. You can have an informal meeting in the treehouse or play the piano in your lunch break!




THE ROLE

As an Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for managing, administering, and maintaining our Looker instance to ensure its optimal performance and reliability. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their analytics needs and implement solutions within Looker. Your role will involve configuring user access, optimizing performance, troubleshooting issues, and staying up-to-date with Looker's latest features and best practices. Additionally, you will be responsible for training users and providing ongoing support to ensure they can effectively leverage Looker for data analysis and reporting.




WHAT YOU'LL DO

Looker Instance Administration:

Configure and maintain Looker instance settings, including user roles, permissions, and access controls.
Manage LookML models, explore files, and dashboards to ensure accuracy, consistency, and efficiency.
Monitor system performance and implement optimizations to enhance query performance and minimize downtime.
Stay informed about Looker releases, updates, and best practices to ensure our instance is up-to-date and aligned with industry standards.




User Support and Training:

Provide training sessions and workshops to onboard new users and empower existing users to effectively utilize Looker for data analysis and reporting.
Offer ongoing support to address user questions, troubleshoot issues, and provide guidance on best practices for using Looker.
Develop and maintain documentation, FAQs, and tutorials to facilitate self-service support and knowledge sharing among users.




Collaboration and Integration:

Collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable insights within Looker.
Work closely with IT and security teams to ensure compliance with data governance policies and security standards.
Integrate Looker with other data sources, tools, and platforms to streamline data workflows and enable seamless data access and analysis.




Quality Assurance and Testing:

Conduct regular quality assurance checks to verify the accuracy and reliability of data models, reports, and dashboards in Looker.
Perform thorough testing of new features, updates, and configurations to identify and resolve any issues or discrepancies before deployment to production.




WHO YOU ARE

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience administering and maintaining Looker instances in a production environment.
Strong understanding of SQL, LookML, and relational databases.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues independently.
Effective communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and data integrity.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.
Show more

Title: Data Governance Analyst (m/f)
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

In this project you‚Äôll contact with the European stock market area and will be able to work for a leading global trading platform that knows the importance of surveillance issues. Despite its development center being located in Porto and all administrative support in Lisbon, you will be part of a multicultural team that is spread across several European cities.

We are looking for a Data Governance Analyst to work in a project in Porto (hybrid model).

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in data management, data governance or related roles;
  • Experience of implementing, using, managing and promoting a Data Cataloguing solution (i.e.metadata tool);
  • Good understanding of data governance principles, frameworks and best practices;
  • Proficiency in SQL;
  • Excellent communication and people skills;
  • Problem-solving and critical thinking: ability to critically analyse issue and pro-actively develop effective options for recommendation;
  • Strong capacity of teamwork;
  • Fluency in English.

We Offer

  • Integration in a dynamic, experienced and friendly team;
  • Technical, behavioral and linguistics training opportunities;
  • Career development.

Do you think your profile fits this job description? Send us your CV to and come join the Dellent Team!

Title: Finance Data Analyst ‚Äì M/F ‚Äì Oporto ‚Äì Open Ended Contract ‚Äì Hybrid
Description:
WHO ARE WE ?

BNP PARIBAS CARDIF, the Insurer for a Changing World.

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for a Finance Data Analyst (M/F) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC FAR DATA TEAM

‚ÄúDonn√©es FAR‚Äù (stands for Finance, Actuary, and Risk Data) Department is in charge of providing data to 3 main departments of the company : Finance, Actuary and Risk. You responsibilities will be to collect, check, and provide data from our business to our internal clients (Finance, Actuary ‚Ä¶) using automated tools.

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN THE FAR DATA TEAM


Participate in data quality audit work on a defined scope:
Participate in the administration of the necessary repositories on its perimeter
Participate in the development of the reference documentation associated with the data
Participate in the governance of data quality


As Our New Finance Data Analyst, You Must Have


Degree in Data Analysis, Finance or Actuarial
Professional background about 3/5 years in data analysis for finance/accounting functions.
Fluent in English (C1 level is mandatory)
Fluency in French (B1-B2 level would be greatly appreciated)
Excel VBA
SAS
Python
Datavizualisation Tools (PowerBi, Qlik‚Ä¶)


What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode ‚Äì a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
And much more‚Ä¶


The work environment is important!


Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.


Our commitments to you


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA;Alteryx experience: + 2 years;Good Knowledge of SQL;Good communication;Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive;Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory);A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others, and an ability to turn ideas into realities;Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.Power BI (nice to have);Previous experience on financial area (nice to have);Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban) (nice to have);French (nice to have).Work Arrangement:Hybrid (At least once a week in the office and 8 days per month in the office).Offer:Health Insurance;3 and a half days of leave per year + 22 vacation days;Unlimited access to Udemy.If you are interested in the opportunity, upload your C.V. or send it to ****** with the reference #16449797 in the subject.AskBlue - Business & Technology #J-18808-Ljbffr

(Sustainable impact);Be agile, accountable, and resilient, according to the circumstances (Entrepreneurial mindset);Purposely striving to succeed together, Porto and Paris, as one team with openness and confidence to improve knowledge, practice, framework, ecosystem (Collective intelligence);Contribute on local initiative and project from awareness, assessment, use case identification, data preparation, implementation, industrialization;Contribute to data community.Tasks:Work closely with business users to understand their requirements to solve business problems;Translate these requirements into an Alteryx workflow, working with other IT teams, local and otherwise, to make data processed and available for users;Develop the workflows following the IT software development governance rules;Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary deliver the data projects;Maintain and do the evolution of created assets during the projects.Requirements:+4 years of experience in a similar role;BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation; Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA;Alteryx experience: + 2 years;Good Knowledge of SQL;Good communication;Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive;Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory);A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others, and an ability to turn ideas into realities;Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.Power BI (nice to have);Previous experience on financial area (nice to have);Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban) (nice to have);French (nice to have).Work Arrangement:Hybrid (At least once a week in the office and 8 days per month in the office).Offer:Health Insurance;3 and a half days of leave per year + 22 vacation days;Unlimited access to Udemy.If you are interested in the opportunity, upload your C.V. or send it to ****** with the reference #16449797 in the subject.AskBlue - Business & Technology #J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: Data & AI Security Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a skilled and passionate Data & AI Security Professional to join our team. As a Data & AI Security Professional, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing innovative Data & AI-driven solutions to address complex business challenges. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to collect, analyze, and interpret data to drive actionable insights and enhance decision-making processes.

Key Responsibilities



You provide technical leadership as we design and deploy secure Data&AI architectures for on premises and cloud solutions.


Leading workshops on the key Data & AI security challenges of our clients.


Experience in preparing system security reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends for project and operational and project governance reporting.


Strong analytical skills to solve technical issues and flexibility in handling multiple issues at once.


Partnering with our clients to find the best Data & AI security solutions.


Driven cyber security professional with a passion for information security.



Qualifications



A Bachelor‚Äôs degree, preferably related to Business IT or Security, such as Business Informatics, Computer Security, Data Science or equivalent.


Basic understanding of Cybersecurity and at least one of the fundamental areas of Data Security: Discovery and Classification or Data Encryption.


Knowledge in programming languages such as Python, R, Scala or related.


Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and statistics.


Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills in addition to strong attention to detail.


Strong collaboration skills, ideally working with global and multi-functional teams.


Fluent in English.


Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

Title: Data Engineer (Hybrid @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: 6+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer;
Expertise on end-to-end Data Pipeline Development, ETL processes and Alteryx;
Knowledge in Data Mesh concepts (Starburst, Trino);
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala;
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases;
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Databricks, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Kafka;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

French AND/OR Portuguese fluency.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?




Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Engineer (Python) (m/f)
Description:
Who Are We

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.

Neotalent, the responsive people.

Find out more about us at .

Role Overview

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join a project in one of our biggest clients in the Lisbon - in the corporate banking sector.

What You Are Like


Experience with Python (mainly Pandas);
Experience with SQL;
Experience with Ansible, Docker and Kubernetes;
Experience with GIT (preferably bitbucket);
Experience with ETL processes;
Optimization of Data processes (efficient queries and memory management practices);
Rigorous person with strong analytical problem solving skills;
Comfortable with English (conversational level).


Why join us


Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
‚Ä¶ and much more!


To Apply

Please send your CV to with MVT_BPandas in the email subject.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
THE TEAM


The Global Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights, and analysis to Global Markets front office.
The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.
Our team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. We are in direct contact with business sponsors, sales, and traders.
We seek to shape the technologies available to the client‚Äôs needs - we plan in processing the data using Python and SQL, while delivering the final product in Tableau, Power BI, APIs, and Chat bots.


Responsabilities


To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends throught what data can tell.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understading their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving skills.
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic solutions.
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stekeholders‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders.
You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges.


Mandatory Experience And Knowledge


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to analysze, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English and Portuguese speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.





This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task




.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Chegou o momento de te desafiares a sair da tua zona de conforto fazendo parte de um grande projeto? Vem trabalhar connosco e potenciar ainda mais o teu desenvolvimento!

Integra uma equipa onde trabalhar√°s com os melhores especialistas em Data. Enquanto Engineer, ter√°s a oportunidade de levar os nossos projetos de transforma√ß√£o ao pr√≥ximo n√≠vel, √† escala global, criando e entregando solu√ß√µes inovadoras de Portugal para o mundo. Procuramos perfis que combinem skills de abstra√ß√£o e alguns conhecimentos t√©cnicos da plataforma, com o mindset orientado para a excel√™ncia do nosso servi√ßo ao cliente.

Na Deloitte nunca trabalhar√°s sozinho e, por isso, oferecemos um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira com forma√ß√£o ajustada ao teu perfil e aos teus objetivos profissionais. Ter√°s uma experi√™ncia profissional que te ir√° inspirar, ao lado de outros talentos como tu, a transformar o mundo como o conhecemos: a torn√°-lo mais humano, eficiente e tecnol√≥gico. Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos √† procura dos melhores especialistas em tecnologia para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excel√™ncia e √† nossa comunidade, para desenvolverem solu√ß√µes √∫nicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transforma√ß√£o.

Est√£o reunidos todos os ingredientes para poderes embarcar nesta viagem enriquecedora e desafiante que √© o mundo Deloitte?

O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades v√£o ser compostos por:

  • Analise de dados em v√°rias tecnologias, SQL e No-SQL;
  • Desenho, implementa√ß√£o, e monitoriza√ß√£o de pipelines ETL;
  • Cria√ß√£o de processos para tratamento de dados (data profiling, cleansing, masking);
  • Desenho e implementa√ß√£o de solu√ß√µes real-time analytics;
  • Desenho e implementa√ß√£o de solu√ß√µes Big Data;
  • Desenho e Implementa√ß√£o de solu√ß√µes data-driven distribu√≠das com recurso a tecnologias Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP);
  • Colaborar com v√°rios stakeholders na defini√ß√£o, tratamento de dados e implementa√ß√£o de modelos avan√ßados de Machine Learning.
  • Garantir a coordena√ß√£o entre equipas t√©cnicas e funcionais no √¢mbito de projetos de dados;


√âs tu quem procuramos:

  • Conhecimento da l√≠ngua Inglesa (oral e escrita) e disponibilidade para viajar; Entre 2 a 6 Anos de experi√™ncia profissional em projetos de Data;
  • Conhecimento de processos de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Experi√™ncia com metodologias Agile;
  • Conhecimentos de linguagens SQL / No SQL;
  • Conhecimentos em Python;
  • Experi√™ncia profissional em solu√ß√µes ETL (exemplos, Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, Snowflake, SSIS, IBM DataStage) (preferencial);
  • Experi√™ncia em solu√ß√µes da Data Visualization (exemplos, Power BI, Tableau);
  • Experi√™ncia profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes;
  • Conhecimento das solu√ß√µes Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribu√≠dos;
  • Experi√™ncia profissional em solu√ß√µes/tecnologias Big Data (exemplos, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, ELK, MongoDB) (preferencial);
  • Orienta√ß√£o para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Comunica√ß√£o, trabalho em equipa, resolu√ß√£o de problemas e capacidade anal√≠tica.


Desenvolve uma carreira √† tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem cont√≠nuos
  • Atrav√©s de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades t√©cnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, √†s tuas necessidades e objetivos
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimens√£o e impacto relevante nesta √°rea de especializa√ß√£o
  • Acesso ilimitado √†s maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy
  • Oportunidade de forma√ß√µes e certifica√ß√µes nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud


Vive uma cultura de uni√£o

  • Uma cultura de inova√ß√£o e excel√™ncia que nos torna l√≠deres e precursores de tend√™ncias
  • Um ambiente amig√°vel, de respeito, confian√ßa, transpar√™ncia e informalidade
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de l√≠deres e especialistas
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte, nunca trabalhar√°s sozinho. Vais integrar os mais variados e desafiantes projetos e fazer parte do nosso Global Solutions Center, onde poder√°s colaborar de forma integrada com outras equipas da rede global Deloitte. Ter√°s sempre algu√©m ao teu lado para te inspirar, ajudar e desafiar a expandir os teus horizontes, enquanto exploras solu√ß√µes tecnol√≥gicas diferenciadoras. Aqui, ao encontrares um ambiente din√¢mico, colaborativo e humano, ter√°s a oportunidade de desenvolver a tua melhor vers√£o.

Al√©m disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal t√™m proje√ß√£o internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte lideran√ßa global em diversas expertises tecnol√≥gicas.

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas compet√™ncias e fazer parte de equipas que desenvolvem solu√ß√µes nas tecnologias l√≠deres de mercado, ent√£o est√°s no lugar certo!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
# Think Data Be Smart #




About Us: DataSmart is a Portuguese company, positioning itself as a consulting company of excellence, with over 20 years of existence. We are specialized in Technologies and Information Systems services for the Portuguese and International markets. We pride ourselves on fostering a culture of involvement, experience, and excellence.




Join our team as a Data Engineer (Hybrid - Porto and Lisbon)!




What You'll Do:

Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes.
Work with Google BigQuery, Snowflake, and Databricks to manage and analyze large datasets.
Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and transformation.
Use Python for data manipulation, automation, and complex data processing tasks.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
Utilize Power BI to create interactive and insightful data visualizations and reports.
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation procedures.
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, ensuring high performance and reliability of data systems.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to continuously improve data engineering practices.




Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
5+years of experience as a Data Engineer.
Extensive experience with Google BigQuery, Snowflake, and Databricks.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong Python programming skills for data processing and automation.
Experience with Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Knowledge of ETL processes and tools.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment and communicate with cross-functional teams.
Fluent in Portuguese and English, both oral and written.




At DataSmart, you will have the opportunity to integrate into a solid company and participate in projects of high recognition, nationally and internationally, with an appealing technological environment and career progression.




Excellence in the way to the future!




Connect with Us: Follow us on LinkedIn for updates on career opportunities, company news, and industry insights! For further details, visit us at www.datasmart.pt




#JoinOurTeam #DataSmart #ThinkDataBeSmart #DataEngineer #BigQuery #Snowflake #Databricks #SQL #Python #PowerBI #ETL #Portugal
