Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced Google BigQuery SQL / Data Engineer to join our team. As a Google BigQuery SQL / Data Engineer, you will be responsible for optimizing data retrieval, analysis, and reporting processes using Google BigQuery. Your expertise will be crucial in designing efficient data models, writing complex queries, and ensuring optimal performance across our data infrastructure. You will also work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver data-driven insights and support data-related projects.

Responsibilities


Design and develop scalable data models and schemas in Google BigQuery.
Write and optimize complex SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Identify and resolve query performance bottlenecks.
Implement data pipelines to automate data collection, processing, and storage.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide data-driven insights.
Ensure data integrity and quality control through validation and testing processes.
Stay updated with the latest advancements and best practices in Google BigQuery, SQL, and data engineering.
Document data processes, models, and queries for transparency and knowledge sharing.
Support data-related projects and initiatives, providing technical expertise and guidance.


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Google BigQuery SQL Expert or Data Engineer.
In-depth knowledge of Google BigQuery, including partitioning, table clustering, and data storage concepts.
Strong proficiency in writing and optimizing complex SQL queries, with a solid understanding of query execution plans.
Familiarity with data modeling, schema design, and data warehousing concepts.
Experience with data validation techniques, data profiling, and quality control processes.
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or Java is a plus.
Experience with data pipeline tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Beam, Dataflow).
Excellent problem-solving skills and strong analytical thinking.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and projects.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with other data engineering tools and platforms (e.g., Apache Airflow, Kafka).
Certifications in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or related technologies.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker) and data visualization techniques.
Experience in a fast-paced, agile development environment.


Benefits


Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and a talented team.
Professional development and continuous learning opportunities.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.


We are looking for a dedicated professional who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business insights and efficiencies. If you have a proven track record with Google BigQuery and SQL, and are excited to work in a collaborative and innovative environment, we encourage you to apply.

Skills: data,sql,concepts,data models,models,validation,writing,skills,google,design,sql clustering,looker,gcp

  • Flexible working hours and remote work options.

We are looking for a dedicated professional who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business insights and efficiencies. If you have a proven track record with Google BigQuery and SQL, and are excited to work in a collaborative and innovative environment, we encourage you to apply.

Skills: data,sql,concepts,data models,models,validation,writing,skills,google,design,sql clustering,looker,gcp

Title: Data Engineer (remote)
HTML:
We are looking for a Data Engineer to join a project in the technology sector.

Responsibilities:

  • Offer guidance on designing and building scalable data processing pipelines;
  • Optimize data workflows to maximize cost efficiency;
  • Work closely with data and development platform teams to ensure smooth integration and operation;
  • Share insights and recommend best practices for both real-time and batch data processing;
  • Ensure data integrity, consistency, and security across the entire pipeline.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field;
  • Over 2 years of professional experience in Data Engineering;
  • Solid understanding of the Event Source Pattern and CQRS principles;
  • Experience in consuming and handling data streams;
  • Ability to differentiate and implement Real-Time Reporting vs. Batch Reporting;
  • killed in managing and optimizing PostgreSQL databases on AWS RDS;
  • Proficient in using AWS Data Migration Service for data replication and Amazon Kinesis for building data streams;
  • Experienced in designing and maintaining Redshift data warehouses and creating ETL processes with AWS Glue;
  • Experienced in data visualization and reporting using Metabase;
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to transform raw data into actionable insights;
  • trong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and completeness in data processes;
  • Fluency in English (mandatory).


Benefits

  • Permanent Contract;
  • Health Insurance;
  • Meal Card;
  • Gym Ticket;
  • Remote (based in Portugal).

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
FARFETCH exists for the love of fashion. Our mission is to be the global platform for luxury fashion, connecting creators, curators and consumers.

We're a positive platform for good, bringing together an incredible creative community made up by our people, our partners and our customers. This community is at the heart of our business success. We welcome differences, empower individuality and celebrate diverse skills and perspectives, creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We are FARFETCH for All.




TECHNOLOGY

We're on a mission to build the technology that powers the global platform for luxury fashion. We operate a modular end-to-end technology platform purpose-built to connect the luxury fashion ecosystem worldwide, addressing complex challenges and enjoying it. We're empowered to break traditions and revolutionise, with the freedom and autonomy to make a difference for our customers all over the world.




PORTO

Our Porto office is located in Portugal's vibrant second city, known for its history and its creative yet cosy environment. From Account Management to Technology and Product, whatever your skills are, you'll find your fit here. You can have an informal meeting in the treehouse or play the piano in your lunch break!




THE ROLE

As an Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for managing, administering, and maintaining our Looker instance to ensure its optimal performance and reliability. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their analytics needs and implement solutions within Looker. Your role will involve configuring user access, optimizing performance, troubleshooting issues, and staying up-to-date with Looker's latest features and best practices. Additionally, you will be responsible for training users and providing ongoing support to ensure they can effectively leverage Looker for data analysis and reporting.




WHAT YOU'LL DO

Looker Instance Administration:

Configure and maintain Looker instance settings, including user roles, permissions, and access controls.
Manage LookML models, explore files, and dashboards to ensure accuracy, consistency, and efficiency.
Monitor system performance and implement optimizations to enhance query performance and minimize downtime.
Stay informed about Looker releases, updates, and best practices to ensure our instance is up-to-date and aligned with industry standards.




User Support and Training:

Provide training sessions and workshops to onboard new users and empower existing users to effectively utilize Looker for data analysis and reporting.
Offer ongoing support to address user questions, troubleshoot issues, and provide guidance on best practices for using Looker.
Develop and maintain documentation, FAQs, and tutorials to facilitate self-service support and knowledge sharing among users.




Collaboration and Integration:

Collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable insights within Looker.
Work closely with IT and security teams to ensure compliance with data governance policies and security standards.
Integrate Looker with other data sources, tools, and platforms to streamline data workflows and enable seamless data access and analysis.




Quality Assurance and Testing:

Conduct regular quality assurance checks to verify the accuracy and reliability of data models, reports, and dashboards in Looker.
Perform thorough testing of new features, updates, and configurations to identify and resolve any issues or discrepancies before deployment to production.




WHO YOU ARE

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience administering and maintaining Looker instances in a production environment.
Strong understanding of SQL, LookML, and relational databases.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues independently.
Effective communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and data integrity.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.
Show more

Title: Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst
Description:
This job will provide you with an opportunity to further your career alongside some of the best and most passionate technology experts from around the world in a leading company within the test, measurement and data analytics industry. You will be a strong contributor collaborating closely with colleagues from various business functions.

At HBK, we live up to our three values: Be True, Own It and Aim High. We believe in absolute integrity ‚Äì it‚Äôs how we win for stakeholders, the environment and each other. We believe in teamwork and keeping our promises ‚Äì to ourselves and others. Finally, we believe in being bold and positive. This is how we perform at our best and achieve greater success.

HBK is a leading organization in Testing and measuring environment who are on a journey to ensure that we are utilizing data-driven insights to make strategic business decisions. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in leveraging SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud to enhance our data analytics and reporting capabilities. The team is currently rebuilding our data landscape, and this is a real opportunity to drive change within the business area.

Job Summary:

As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will take a leadership role in gathering, analyzing, and transforming data into actionable insights that drive informed decision-making HBK. Drawing upon your extensive expertise in SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver advanced data solutions and enhance operational efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Strategy: Develop and execute a comprehensive data strategy that leverages SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud to meet the organization's analytical needs and objectives.
Advanced Analytics: Apply advanced statistical and predictive analytics techniques to uncover trends, patterns, and insights in data, enabling more informed decision-making.
Reporting Excellence: Lead the design and maintenance of sophisticated, interactive reports and dashboards using SAP Analytical Cloud. Create highly visual and intuitive data visualizations for use by business stakeholders.
Data Integration and Governance: Oversee the integration of data from diverse sources, ensuring data quality, consistency, and adherence to data governance policies. Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to optimize data pipelines.
Performance Optimization: Continuously enhance the performance of SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud, including optimizing data processing and reporting capabilities.
Business Requirements Analysis: Work closely with business leaders to understand their analytical needs and translate these requirements into actionable data solutions.
Data Modeling Expertise: Design and implement complex data models to facilitate advanced reporting and analytics, encompassing both logical and physical data models.
Data Security and Compliance: Ensure strict data security and compliance with internal policies and industry regulations throughout all data handling and reporting activities.
Mentorship and Training: Provide guidance and training to other analysts and end-users on SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud, fostering self-service analytics adoption.


Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
A minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst with a strong focus on SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud.
In-depth expertise in data warehousing, ETL processes, data modeling, and advanced analytics techniques.
Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with data visualization tools.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and analytical thinking.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Proven ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams.
Knowledge of industry best practices and emerging trends in business intelligence and data analytics.


Additional Information:


Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package.
Opportunities for career growth and professional development within our organization.
A collaborative and innovative work environment equipped with state-of-the-art data analytics tools.


If you are a seasoned professional with a passion for utilizing SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud to drive advanced data-driven decision-making, we invite you to apply and become a pivotal part of our team at HBK. Join us in shaping the future of data analytics for our business's success.
